Florida Scholarships


#Becausewewill Educational Award
Submit your inspiring story for a chance to win $1,000.
#BecauseWeWill is an interactive social media campaign designed to give learners an opportunity to share personal stories and build a sense of community, support, and belonging with other learners across the country.
The campaign raises public awareness about student struggles and amplifies the voices of learners across the United States. It aims to create a virtual community for learners to find mutual support and encouragement as they persevere on their own journeys.
By sharing their personal stories, learners create a network of support to inspire learners facing similar circumstances and are considered for a chance to win $1,000.
For more information please visit our website at: https://www.becausewewill.org/ more...

2022 Brown Bag Marketing Video Scholarship
BROWN BAG RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANCE OF INVESTING IN OUR COMMUNITY.
This future-focused mission is the driving force behind our desire to provide opportunities and advancements for current students and soon-to-be business professionals, tradespeople, educators, politicians and leaders. For this reason, we are proud to sponsor a privately-funded scholarship program to give a smart, creative and talented college student a helping hand.
VIDEO SCHOLARSHIP DETAILS
Where is your perfect place to create?
We want to know more about your favorite environment that allows you to do your best work and see you in action. Create a video story in 90 seconds or less showcasing your favorite place to create and tell us why it works for you for a chance to win Brown Bag’s second annual scholarship contest!
Eligibility: All students who are currently enrolled in an accredited community college, undergraduate, or graduate program in the United States are welcome to apply.
Instructions: To enter our video scholarship competition, please submit your video and application using the form at the bottom of this page. Please keep your video to 90 seconds or less.
Selection process: Our judges will examine all entries received by the deadline. A winner will be selected up to 6 weeks after the submission deadline and will be notified via email and phone call. One winner will be awarded the scholarship amount, and notable entries may also be published on our website. more...

A.J. And Ivy Bacon Scholarship Fund
Recipient must be pursuing a degree at Florida State University Panama City, possess and maintain a minimum 2.5 GPA, and must be enrolled in at least 6 credit hours. Preference will be given to students pursuing a degree in the College of Social Work.
One of the purposes of this scholarship is to increase diversity at Florida State University. Any student may apply to be considered for the award; however, it is the preference of the donor that the recipient also be a Veteran. more...

A3 Superior Pest Control Scholarship
How to Apply for the A3 Superior Pest Control Scholarship
Are you a college or university student or are you about to become one?
If you or someone you know could use the money towards college we are offering a $1000 ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP on a yearly basis to all eligible students.
To be eligible we require the following:
Minimum GPA of 2.5
Must be a legal resident of the United States
Be an Undergraduate, Graduate or Incoming student
Must be planning on earning a Bachelor of Science degree. Environmental Science is a plus!
General information on the scholarship:
Submission deadline is December 1 of each year.
Date of award is January 31 of each year.
*Submissions are allowed throughout the year. This scholarship will be awarded yearly. *
The scholarship award is based on an essay of 750 to 1000 words. The essay should explain what Major you are seeking, why you are picking your particular Major, any experiences that have helped foster the desire to gain this degree, and your future goals and aspirations.
Please note that any essay submitted will become the property of A3 Superior Pest Control. No purchase of any type is required.
Please submit your scholarship essay by filling out the following form or you may email it to scholarship@a3superiorpestcontrol.com more...

Abacus Scholarship
Abacus Life Settlements is proud to announce we are offering a scholarship for the 2022-2023 school year.
We would love to have our company’s scholarship listed on your school’s website to increase the number of applicants we receive. Details of our scholarship are listed below.
Scholarship Details:
Applicants must be a full or part-time students at an accredited 4-year College or University in the United States.
Each applicant should include a video describing “What makes you unique”. Videos should be a maximum of 3 minutes in length. Acceptable formats are Youtube and Vimeo.
Minimum GPA Requirements: None
All applications should be emailed to Scholarships@AbacusLife.com for consideration and should include: Completed application form (attached), video, and transcripts.
Please reach out to Scholarships@AbacusLife.com if any additional information is needed. more...

Adam M. Johnson Endowed Fund For Excellence
Recipient must be a graduate student in the College of Arts and Sciences within the Department of English Creating Writing Program whose narrative work involves or requires off campus research.
The off-campus research might include, but is not limited to, research at national libraries, museums and other institutions within the United States and abroad. Please submit a brief (500 word) description of your project, along with a brief sample (10 pages fiction, 3 pages poetry) of the work itself. more...

Albert D. Ernest, Jr. Caring Award
The Caring Awards committee seeks to recognize a UNF student that embodies the spirit of caring, volunteerism, and humanitarianism. The award is an opportunity to recognize and honor the bright, dedicated, and selfless individuals who take the time and strive to make the world a better place to live.
The UNF student who is selected will receive a bronze sculpture created by the late Frank Eliscu, nationally known sculptor, designer of the Heisman Trophy, the Oval Office’s Presidential Eagle and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. The recipient will be honored during a commencement ceremony and will receive $1,000.00 to donate in their name to a charity of their choosing. Four finalists will receive $200.00 each to donate to their selected charity. All finalists are invited to attend an awards luncheon.
The Albert D. Ernest, Jr. Caring Award, established in 1992 by the friends of Albert D. Ernest, Jr. and Barnett bank of Jacksonville, FL, is a fitting tribute to a UNF student who displays the spirit of caring, humanitarianism and volunteerism for which Mr. Ernest is admired. Although his volunteer efforts are extensive, Mr. Ernest’s most significant contribution is his unique ability to empower others. Through personal example, he encourages others to develop a deep sense of caring about the people around them. His vision to see things as they should be and his ability to motivate and inspire those around him have resulted in untold positive changes. more...

Alex Alfred Ankiewicz And Lucy Elizabeth Ankiewicz Scholarship Endowment

Alexa M. Duran Memorial First Generation Scholarship
Established in loving memory of Alexa M. Duran, the Alexa M. Duran Memorial First Generation Scholarship is awarded to First Generation students at FIU.
Eligibility Requirements
Recipients must demonstrate financial need by completing the national Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and be eligible for a Pell Grant.
Recipients must be the first generation in their family to attain a college bachelor’s degree (students whose siblings have attained or are pursuing a degree are also eligible).
Recipients must be residents of the state of Florida.
Recipients must be enrolled in or accepted for admission to the university and be a degree-seeking undergraduate student enrolled for a minimum of twelve credit hours per semester.
Recipients should be pursuing a degree at FIU.
Minimum 3.25 GPA

Preference to students in SIPA with an interest in pursuing a Political Science or Law degree
Preference to student with most financial need
Strong consideration based on application essay
Questions? Contact the Office of Scholarships at 305-348-0349 or scholarships@fiu.edu. more...

Alexander Rochell Opportunity Scholarship In Engineering
Recipient must be a student in the College of Engineering in good academic standing who is the first generation of their families to attend college. First preference will be given to a student within the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering. Second preference will be given to a student studying any field of engineering.
One of the purposes of this scholarship is to increase diversity at Florida State University. Any student may apply to be considered for the award; however, it is the preference of the donor that the recipient be a Hispanic student. more...

Alfred I. Dupont Foundation Scholarship Fund
Recipient must be an undergraduate student attending the Panama City Campus with a minimum 2.5 GPA who demonstrates financial need. First preference will be given to a student from Port St. Joe, FL. Second preference will be given to a student from Wewahitchka, FL. Third preference will be given to a student from Gulf County, FL. Fourth preference will be given to a student from Franklin County, FL. Fifth preference will be given to a student from Bay County, FL. Sixth preference will be given to a student from Northwest Florida. Seventh preference will be given to any Florida resident.

All Academic Team Scholars

All American Clothing Scholarship
For two decades, All American Clothing Co. has provided countless American families with employment opportunities through local clothing production. We pride ourselves in manufacturing homegrown, high-quality classic apparel, from timeless blue jeans to footwear.
This year, we are excited to give back more to the community by supporting a deserving student with our scholarship program. This opportunity is open to any US resident or student visa holder aged 18 or above. They must also be enrolled in any undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited US college or university.
The scholarship awardee will be chosen based solely on the quality of their essay submission. No other requirements such as GPA scores or academic transcripts are necessary. One recipient will be awarded a scholarship worth $1,000 for academic fees or necessities.
With All American Clothing Co.’s motto of “Make Something Happen Today” in mind, we hope to make a meaningful impact by supporting educational endeavors within our community.
SCHOLARSHIP DETAILS
Scholarship Name: All American Clothing $1,000 Scholarship
Deadline: January 12, 2023
Value: $1,000
Available slots: 1
SCHOLARSHIP ELIGIBILITY
Applicants must be legal residents of the United States or hold a valid student visa.
Applicants must be currently enrolled to attend an accredited community college, undergraduate, or graduate program within the United States.
Applicants must be 18 years or older.
HOW TO APPLY
Applicants must write a 1000-word essay discussing this topic: “How do you think buying products made locally can positively impact our country?”
Essays must be sent to scholarship@allamericanclothing.com as an attached PDF file, including the applicants’ full name, address, contact information, school name, and date of birth.
Use the subject line: All American Clothing Scholarship | (Your Name)
Only one submission per person is allowed. You must be able to prove your eligibility based on the above criteria. more...

All Florida Academic Team Scholarships

Allied Van Lines Scholarship
Allied Van Lines, one of the leading long distance and cross country moving companies in America, is excited to offer a 2022 scholarship program aimed at students whose area of study focuses on logistics and moving-related fields. We are committed to growing our industry and supporting the brightest students in logistics and moving.
Award Criteria:
3 individual scholarships will be awarded.
Individual scholarship award amount of $1,000 per winner. Total scholarship awards: $3,000
Award amount will be made out to the winner’s school in the form of a check, and mailed to the winner’s personal address.
Entry Requirements:
Submit a brief essay of between 400 and 800 words, detailing why a career in logistics/supply chain management is your college major of choice. A personalized tone, referencing sincere firsthand experience and sentiment, is best—no need to be too formal. We want to know why you truly believe in logistics as the best career path for you!
Application Requirements:
Complete all required sections of our application form below.
Be sure to attach the following documents to your application form:

1) Copy of your most recent transcripts.
2) Some verification of enrollment at your college.
3) Your Essay.
For more information, please click the “Visit” link below more...

Allied Van Lines Scholarship
Allied Van Lines, one of the leading long-distance and cross-country moving companies in America, is excited to offer a 2022 scholarship program aimed at students whose area of study focuses on logistics and moving-related fields. We are committed to growing our industry and supporting the brightest students in logistics and moving.
Award Criteria:
3 individual scholarships will be awarded.
Individual scholarship award amount of $1,000 per winner. Total scholarship awards: $3,000
Award amount will be made out to the winner’s school in the form of a check, and mailed to the winner’s personal address.
Entry Requirements:
Submit a brief essay of between 400 and 800 words, detailing why a career in logistics/supply chain management is your college major of choice. A personalized tone, referencing sincere firsthand experience and sentiment, is best—no need to be too formal. We want to know why you truly believe in logistics as the best career path for you!
Application Requirements:
Complete all required sections of our application form below.
Be sure to attach the following documents to your application form:

Copy of your most recent transcripts.
Some verification of enrollment at your college.
Your Essay.
Eligibility Requirements:
U.S. Citizen (or permanent resident).
Enrolled (or enrolling) as full time student of accredited college/university within the United States for completion of undergraduate degree in Logistics or equivalent field.
Limit of one (1) entry per contestant.
Employees, professional affiliates, and agents of Allied Van Lines (and their immediate families) are not eligible.
The applicant must comply with IRS rules to qualify for the tax-free benefits of the scholarship, including following.

It does not exceed your expenses;
It is not designated or earmarked for other purposes (such as room and board), and does not require (by its terms) that it cannot be used for qualified education expense; and
It does not represent payment for teaching, research, or other services required as a condition for receiving the scholarship.
You must be a Candidate for a Degree. You are a Candidate for a Degree if

Attend a primary or secondary school or are pursuing a degree at a college or university, or
Attend an educational institution that:

Provides a program that is acceptable for full credit toward a bachelor’s or higher degree, or offers a program of training to prepare students for gainful employment in a recognized occupation; and
Is authorized under federal or state law to provide such a program and is accredited by a nationally recognized accreditation agency




Eligible educational institution. An eligible educational institution is one whose primary function is the presentation of formal instruction and that normally maintains a regular faculty and curriculum and normally has a regularly enrolled body of students in attendance at the place where it carries on its educational activities.
Qualified education expenses. For purposes of tax-free scholarships and fellowship grants, these are expenses for:

Tuition and fees required to enroll at or attend an eligible educational institution; and
Course-related expenses, such as fees, books, supplies, and equipment that are required for the courses at the eligible educational institution. These items must be required of all students in your course of instruction.


Qualified education expenses do not include the cost of:

Room and board, Travel, Research, Clerical help, or Equipment and other expenses that are not required for enrollment in or attendance at an eligible educational institution
Winners
Winners will be notified via email, and on our official Logistics Scholarship homepage at (Allied.com/scholarship/logisticsedu).
Recipients must comply with IRS rules to qualify for the tax benefits of the scholarship
DISCLAIMER: Sirva, Inc. and any related subsidiaries will not re-use, forward, or share the personal information of applicants in any way—all information submitted through the form available on this page or any alternative forms of entry are to be kept strictly confidential and used solely for the purpose of determining a winner. more...

Army Nurse (Rn) Corps
Nurses
66B ARMY PUBLIC HEALTH

66C PSYCHIATRIC / BEHAVIORAL HEALTH

66E PERIORPERATIVE (O.R.)
66F NURSE ANESTHETIST

66G OBSTERIC-GYNECOLOGIC (O.B.- GYN)
66H MEDICAL SURGICAL

66N OPERATIONAL (IMMATERIAL)
66P FAMILY NURSE PRACTITIONER (FNP)
66R PSYCHIATRIC NURSE PRACTITIONER (PNP)
66S CRITICAL CARE (ICU)
66T EMERGENCY (TRAUMA)
66W CERTIFIED NURSE MIDWIFE
Additional Specializations:
Healthcare Recruiter (4N)
Clinical Nurse Specialist (7T)
Case Management (M9)
Aviation NP (N1)
Informatics (N2)
Active Duties Incentives:
Active Duty Accession Bonus
Critical Wartime Accession Skills Bonus
Active Duty Health Professions Loan Repayment Program (ADHPLRP)
U.S. Army Graduate Program in Anesthesia Nursing (USAGPAN)
Health Professions Scholarship Program (HPSP)
Critical Care Nurse (66S) Student Program
Ammed Enlisted Commissioning Program (AECP) – only for current enlisted soldiers.
RESERVE DUTY INCENTIVES:
Special Pay (Annual per term)
Specialized Training Assistance Program (STRAP)
Health Professions Loan Repayment Program (HPLRP)
BASIC ELIGIBILITY:
Bachelor of Science in Nursing; Master of Science in Nursing; Doctor of Nursing Practice (BSN at a minimum)
Nursing program accredited by ACEN or CCNE

Hold a current, valid, active and unrestricted license to practice nursing and current BLS

AD – U.S. Citizen; USAR – Permanent residents or U.S. Citizens
66F CRNAs: accredited by Council on Accreditation (COA), ACLS

66S ICU: CCRN, ACLS

66T Trauma: CEN, recommended also TNCC

66E: O.R.: CNOR

Max age depends on Area of Concentration (AOC)
Contact us to Apply!

Orlando, FL 32803

Ate Ballistic Helmet (College) Scholarship
We are pleased to offer two scholarships to those looking to start or further their education in the university setting and also for current officers in a training set! We want to help protect this knowledge, and if you complete your schooling or training successfully, HHV will provide a ballistic helmet free of cost
College Fund ($1,000 + ATE Ballistic Helmet) is for those who plan on seeking a degree in Law Enforcement
To Qualify:
Must be pursuing careers in the fields of law enforcement full time.
Be accepted for full-time enrollment at an accredited two-year American university, and seek to become a police officer.
Students should include an official high school transcript signed by their guidance counselor.
1000-word essay outlining why they want to pursue a career in law enforcement.
Two letters of recommendation.
Complete Application Below.
Deadline For All College Fund Scholarships (31 MAR & 01 OCT Of The Current Year) more...

Ate Ballistic Helmet (Training Fund) Scholarship
We are pleased to offer two scholarships to those looking to start or further their education in the university setting and also for current officers in a training set! We want to help protect this knowledge, and if you complete your schooling or training successfully, HHV will provide a ballistic helmet free of cost
Training Fund ($1,000+ ATE Ballistic Helmet) is for those who are already officers looking to further their training.
To Qualify
Must be a full-time police officer.
Must show approval by a supervisor to attend training.
1000-word essay on what are the most difficult aspects of your job and how you manage and improve on them?
Minimum of three years of LEO service
One letter of recommendation.
Complete Application Below.
Deadline For All College Fund Scholarships (31 MAR & 01 OCT Of The Current Year)
For more information about these scholarship opportunities please visit https://www.hardheadveterans.com/pages/ate-ballistic-helmet-scholarships. more...

Avalaunch Media Scholarship
At the base of the Wasatch Mountain Range sits Avalaunch Media’s headquarters. Within the office, you’ll find a 2-foot statue of a yeti symbolizing the mission and purpose of our team. Although some don’t know what a yeti is, or if it even exists, the tall tale of the yeti inspires us. We’re on a quest to create believers in digital marketing through measurable results.
Our abominable snowman – Eddy the Yeti – surrounds our team of digital marketers who believe. Are you a believer?
We are excited to announce the launch of our annual Avalaunch Media Scholarship Contest. The winner will receive a $1,000 scholarship. Avalaunch Media is committed to supporting students in their educational pursuits and helping to develop the next generation of believers.
Who is Eligible:
Any current, full-time student of an accredited two-year or four-year American university or college is welcome to apply. There is no age or specific major requirement.
How to Apply:
Students who fit the eligibility requirements listed above can apply for the scholarship. To enter, applicants must submit an essay (Maximum of 500 words) or video (Less than 2 minutes) on one of the following topics:
How have you created believers in yourself and your story?
All candidates must send a link to their video or email their essay to our scholarship committee at scholarship@avalaunchmedia.com. In addition, all participants are required to post their submissions on AT LEAST one of their personal social media accounts.
For video entries, load the video to your social media account of choice. To share word documents on your account, applicants can either load the entire document onto a post OR share a link to the document via Google Docs or another similar platform. (If you share the link, make sure you allow “Read Only” and don’t provide editing privileges.)
Social Media Instructions
Facebook, Google+: At the end of your post, add the following: www.avalaunchmedia.com | #HowICreateBelievers
Instagram: after you post your video, put in the caption: www.avalaunchmedia.com | #HowICreateBelievers
Youtube: In your video title include #HowICreateBelievers and in the description add this link: https://avalaunchmedia.com
We encourage you to share your post(s) as traction is created through likes, shares, and comments. This may be used as one of the determining factors in judging.
Submission to Avalaunch Media Scholarship Committee
Once posted to your social media account, please email us your essay/video at scholarship@avalaunchmedia.com. Please include:
Link to post/video
Full name
Email address
Phone number
Your school, major, and graduation date
Deadline for Submission:
The essay submission deadline is December 1st, 2022.
Selection Process and Notification:
The Avalaunch Media Scholarship Committee will review all essays received and one winner will be chosen prior to the spring semester. Once the winner has been determined, he or she will be contacted directly by Avalaunch Media on December 1st.
Additional Details:
The scholarship funds awarded are to be used for tuition and books only. Once awarded, a check will be written to the recipient’s school of choice and credited for academic costs. The scholarship is non-renewable. Recipients are only eligible to receive the scholarship once during their lifetime.
Questions?
Any questions about the scholarship essay contest can be directed to scholarship@avalaunchmedia.com. more...

Applicants must be in good standing in the AFJROTC program at APHS. The head of the AFJROTC program at APHS will serve on the committee to select recipients. Due dates are June 1 for fall, October 15 for spring and March 1 for summer. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Avon Park Noon Rotary Music Scholarship
Scholarship for students attending South Florida Community College (SFCC) full- or part-time, interested in Music. Preference given to students with demonstrated financial need. Applicants must be recommended by the Music Program Manager based on a performance audition. Recipients must maintain minimum attendance according to College policy. Recipients must give maximum effort and cooperation during rehearsals and performances and must participate in scheduled performances. Due dates are June 1 for fall, October 15 for spring and March 1 for summer. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Scholarship for Highlands County, Florida residents attending South Florida Community College full-time. Preference given to students with greatest financial need. Preference also given to students in one of these categories: state certified firefighter, state certified paramedic, or family member of one of these categories. Scholarship for Florida residents who are graduating high school seniors from Hardee, Lake Placid, DeSoto, Ft. Meade, Sebring, Frostproof, or Avon Park High Schools that are planning to attend South Florida Community College full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrated financial need. Candidates must be a direct descendent of a Mexican farm worker family and be willing to volunteer 20 hours/year for community service at the Sonshine House of Avon Park. Ben Hill Griffin Inc., Cinco De Mayo Scholarship
The Ben Hill Griffin Inc., Cinco de Mayo Scholarship is available to students at South Florida Community College. You must be a graduating senior from Hardee, Lake Placid, DeSoto, Ft. Mead, Sebring, Frostproof or Avon high schools with a GPA of at least 3.0 who has been accepted for full-time enrollment at SFCC. You must be the direct descendant of a Mexican farm-working family to be eligible for this award. You must also demonstrate financial need and commit to a minimum of 20 hours of community service at the Sonshine House of Avon Park. more...

Bennett Frank Buie Endowed Scholarship Fund In Geology

Benson & Bingham Annual Scholarship
In 2017, Benson & Bingham decided to give back to the community with the inception of its first annual Law Scholarship. Benson & Bingham understand the rigors of law school accompanied with the expense to become an attorney and felt obliged to help alleviate the financial strain with their annual scholarship offer. The firm is pleased to announce that we are awarding not just a grand prize of $2,000, but two additional $250 runner-up awards at the completion of the scholarship contest.
Scholarship Criteria:
To be eligible for the scholarship award, applicants must adhere to the following scholarship criteria:
Currently enrolled in or recently accepted to an accredited law school.
A United States citizen or permanent resident.
Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. A copy of your college transcript (unofficial) must accompany the application.
Proof of Law School acceptance or attendance must accompany the application.
Applications must be received electronically by August 31, 2022 to the following email address: scholarship@bensonbingham.com. In the subject line, please reference: Benson & Bingham 2022 Scholarship Application.
Questions regarding the application or process may be submitted to the above email address. Please, No Phone Calls.
Awards:
One grand prize winner will receive a one-time payment of $2,000 to be applied to the law school for their admission/attendance.
Additionally,* two $250* payments will be awarded to two runner-up applicants.
Essays may be published by Benson & Bingham, so please refrain from submitting anything personal, vulgar, or inappropriate for the web.
The winners of the award will be announced by October 31st, 2022.
Scholarship Guidelines:
Entrants for our scholarship must submit a minimum of a* 600-word typed essay* on one of the below topics to be judged by partners Joe Benson and Ben Bingham at the conclusion of the deadline:
Under Nevada Law, is the Tesla “Autopilot” feature grounds for a product’s liability lawsuit for defective design if it malfunctions during engagement of the autopilot feature when a driver is not engaged, based on the manufacturer Tesla marketing the feature as “Full Self-Driving”?
Under Nevada Law, Medical Malpractice cases are capped at $350,000 for “non-economic” damages. Compare the negative effects this cap has on the public at large vs. the benefits to insurance companies.
Judging the essay’s value will be contingent on the below qualities:
The originality of thought or provocativeness of the article.
Attention to current law as well as statistical knowledge of the area of investigation.
Submissions must be 100% original and never published or disseminated at a previous time.
Candidates may site case law or historical records with appropriate citations to the source.
The Las Vegas personal injury attorneys at Benson & Bingham welcome any potential candidates who meet the above criteria and complete the application by August 31st, 2022.
Good luck to all the applicants for our first annual scholarship. The winning entry’s submission, as well as a press release, will accompany the award when the winner is announced on October 31st, 2022. more...

Bioptimizers Scholarship
At biOptimizers, we’re focused on helping people of all ages reach their full potential through better health and wellness. To help aspiring students reach their educational goals, we’re announcing a yearly essay contest.
Eligibility Requirements
Our team at biOptimizers knows just how hard it is to go to school while working against acquired and genetic conditions, and we’re here to help in any way we can. We’d love these $500, $1000, and $1500 scholarships to go to dedicated, focused, and hardworking college students who have shown an interest in biological optimization. If you are over the age of 18 and you’re enrolled in a full- or part-time program at an accredited university, you are eligible to win our scholarship.
First place will be awarded a $1500 scholarship
Second place will be awarded a $1000 scholarship
Third place will be awarded a $500 scholarship.
The Application Process
We’d like to open this contest to the widest possible entrant pool, so we’ve made the application process as easy as possible. Follow these steps to apply:
Write an essay of 1000 words or more on one of these three topics:
“How Improving the Microbiome Will Be the Medicine of the Future”
“How to Harness the Power of the Microbiome to Achieve Happiness and Success”
“How Optimizing Brain Performance Will Allow One to Reach Their Full Potential”
Send your essay to us at contact@bioptimizers.com on or before September 6, 2022.
Save the essay in Microsoft Word or PDF format—we can’t accept Dropbox or Google Docs links.
Be sure your work is 100% original.
Don’t forget to include your name, your contact information, and the name of your university.
It’s important that you only send the information we’ve requested, as extra submissions may slow the editorial process.
BiOptimizers will not share or publish your essay or your information, we will only publish winning essays to our website.
Choosing A Winner
After the September 6, 2022 deadline, our team will evaluate all entries based on their originality, creativity, and quality and pick first, second, and third place winners. First place will be awarded a $1500 scholarship, second place will be awarded a $1000 scholarship, and third place will be awarded a $500 scholarship.
We will choose a winner on September 20, 2022, and we will notify them by phone and by email on that day. more...

Blankstyle Scholarship
Blankstyle Scholarship Opportunity #2
$1000 to be awarded
Apply starting 06/01/2022
Deadline 12/31/2022
Awarding scholarship 01/31/2023
At Blankstyle.com we realize the importance of education. Our employees range from artists to content writers, and from programmers to customer service representatives. The commonality with our team is great communication hinging on a solid foundation of education. We understand that in today’s economy it is expensive and challenging to obtain a quality education. As we benefit from our educated team here at Blankstyle.com, so does the world in that education equates to a brighter future for all who seek it.
The scholarship: In our best effort to provide even more opportunities to more amazing students, we are proud to announce that Blankstyle.com is now offering $1000 scholarships bi-annually! Our scholarships are ALWAYS 100% FREE to participate in. We are awarding these Merit-based scholarships to be used towards the following education-related expenses.
Student Housing
Books
Tuition
School supplies
Qualified Applicants:
a high school senior that has been accepted to an accredited university or
a current student enrolled in college courses.
Application Requirements
Provide basic background information
Summarize your accomplishments and aspirations
Tell us why you deserve this scholarship and how it will help accomplish your goals
Just for fun tell us how t-shirts have played a role in your life more...

Bloomsybox “Growing Together” Scholarship
The mission of BloomsyBox is to deliver happiness and joy to everyone with our longer-lasting flowers and to support farms that care about their workers and the environment. We enjoy being involved in our community to help those in need.
We understand that having a college education can make a huge difference in a person’s future success. Of course, it can be difficult to obtain a college degree due to the cost of living, along with tuition, books, and other necessities for college classes. At BloomsyBox.com, we want to help make someone’s college education a real opportunity, and therefore, we are offering a $1,000 scholarship to help a student enrolled in college.
We’re looking for students who demonstrate excellent leadership skills and commitment to their community.
Qualifications for Students Eligibility Requirements:
Be currently enrolled at a college or university and planning to attend in 2022-2023.
Have a cumulative GPA of 3.8 on undergraduate college coursework.
Demonstrate Community service – this should be included in the essay.
Write an essay of at least 200 words stating how the scholarship can benefit you and your educational plans.
Include your full name, address, email, phone, and evidence demonstrating you meet the qualifications.
The BloomsyBox’s “Growing Together” scholarship will be offered to one student.
The application deadline is September 16th, 2022 and the scholarship will be awarded on Nov 9th, 2022.
The scholarship award will be in the amount of $1,000 and will be given directly to the student.
Please email this information, along with your essay to bloomsybox@gmail.com.
Incomplete submissions will be disqualified.
BloomsyBox is the one-stop shop for the best flower subscription and more! Our monthly flowers makes life more enjoyable. Whether you want flowers delivered regularly to your house or to someone else as a flower gift, our flexible flower delivery service allows you to customize many aspects of your deliveries. Since we are vertically integrated, our flower shipping process is streamlined, making for a shorter journey from our farms to your doorstep. We breed, grow, cut and arrange our own flowers. Sending one of our flower subscriptions to your special someone makes for a flower gift they’ll never forget! Whether you are sending birthday flowers, anniversary flowers, Mother’s Day flowers, or sending flowers “just because” – a flower subscription makes the perfect gift! Choose from a variety of different flower subscription plans and frequencies, including monthly flowers, weekly flowers, rose subscriptions, and our exclusive New York Botanical Garden Collection subscription. And, you can always be sure, our flowers are anything but ordinary. We only ship the finest flowers grown at eco-friendly flower farms that are Rainforest Alliance certified. Although we specialize in flower subscriptions, we also offer gorgeous one-time products in our flower shop. Choose from our sumptuous red rose bouquets, cheerful sunflower bouquets, exotic tropical bouquets, breathtaking garden roses, unique mixed bouquets, fresh green plants, and much more. Send flowers to bring a smile to anyone special – send BloomsyBox! more...

Blossom Law Caregiver Scholarship
Blossom Law provides valuable and compassionate legal services to families who are often juggling bills and struggling with debt. Charlotte bankruptcy attorney Rashad Blossom personally understands the integral role that a family can play in times of hardship, and he appreciates the strong foundation that family members can provide, especially when they provide care for their loved ones.
In honor of his mother, Bobbie Blossom, who was a caregiver for his father, Rashad established The Blossom Law Caregiver Scholarship in 2022 to offer financial relief to students who have a parent who has been the primary caregiver for a loved one or who have served as caregivers themselves. Twice a year, Blossom Law offers college students the opportunity to receive $1,000 through the Blossom Law Caregiver Scholarship. The award may be used to supplement the costs of tuition, room and board, and other educational expenses.
To reach our scholarship team with questions or concerns, please contact us at scholarships@blossomlaw.com
Who Is Eligible to Apply?
Before submitting your application for the Blossom Law Caregiver Scholarship, please make sure that you meet the following criteria:
You are at least 18 years of age
You are enrolled as an undergraduate or graduate student at an accredited college or university
You are a citizen or permanent resident of the United States
You earned a 3.0-grade point average or higher in your most recently completed semester
What Are the Application Requirements?
The Blossom Law Caregiver Scholarship requires each applicant to submit an original essay (approximately 500-1000 words) answering the provided promptly. Along with the essay, we also request that you submit contact information, proof of enrollment, and documentation of your most recently achieved GPA.
ESSAY PROMPT
Being a loved one’s caregiver is an incredible act of service, and it is often a thankless job. If you have a parent who has provided care for a loved one, or if you have been a caregiver yourself, how has this experience affected your priorities or long-term goals? How will this new perspective prepare you for the future?
How Are the Applications Judged?
Each application with be reviewed by our scholarship team. Submissions will be evaluated using these standards:
The student has provided all requested documentation
The student meets all eligibility requirements
The submitted essay is creative, organized, and features high-quality writing
Questions?
The Blossom Law Scholarship Team is happy to answer any questions you may have regarding our program or application process. Please direct all concerns and comments to scholarship@blossomlaw.com. Our team will get back to you in a timely manner. more...

Brotherhood Of Ten Scholarship

Bumblebee Linens Scholarship
Here at Bumblebee Linens, we celebrate students who strive for excellence, and we are proud to launch our first scholarship for an outstanding university student.
This scholarship will be open to both undergrad and graduate students who are attending an accredited university within the United States.
The Bumblebee Linens scholarship provides a one-time reward of $500 to pay for tuition, books, computers, room, and board, or any education-related expense.
There are no GPA requirements and no application forms. This is our way of giving back and supporting individuals who want to pursue their dreams through education.
Details
Scholarship name: Bumblebee Linens $500 Scholarship
Deadline: August 22, 2022. No applications will be accepted after that date.
Scholarship value: $500.
Number of scholarships available: One per year
Who Can Apply?
Must be 18 years or older
Must be a legal resident of United States or hold a valid student visa
Must be currently enrolled in or accepted to a full-time undergraduate or graduate program in an accredited U.S. university, college, or school
How to Apply
The applicant must write a 1000-word essay on a meaningful event that changed your life.
Essays must be sent to scholarships@bumblebeelinens.com as an attached Word document file, along with the applicant’s full name, address, phone number, school name, and date of birth. “Bumblebee Linens $500 Scholarship | Full Name” should be used as the subject line of the email.
Only one submission per person is allowed and you must follow these instructions exactly. Applicants must be able to prove their eligibility based on the abovementioned criteria.
By applying, you agree to allow Bumblebee Linens to use your photo and personal information for marketing purposes if you are the chosen winner.
Selection Details
Send us your response following the guidelines above. Our team will pick the best response and will notify the winner via email on or before September 22, 2022. The winner should respond within 7 days; otherwise, another awardee will be selected.
For further information, interested students can contact scholarships@bumblebeelinens.com. more...

Cameron G Scholderer Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to students of the Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management.
Eligibility Criteria:
Must be a Junior enrolled for a minimum of 9 credit hours/semester
Must have a minimum GPA of 3.0
Must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident
Must have participated in the South Beach Wine and Food Festival or have a proven interest in beverage innovation, as well as demonstrate exemplary leadership that reflects the legacy of Cameron G. Scholderer (Submit short essay providing a statement sharing that you have participated in the SOBE Wine and Food Festival or statement on your proven interest in beverage innovation, examples and details is highly recommended).
Must submit a letter of recommendation from a beverage management faculty member or representative of the festival management team highlighting the student’s demonstration of exemplary leadership skills.
Each recipient is to serve as a mentor to the following recipient so that the leadership qualities that Cameron G. Scholderer demonstrated are conveyed to each scholarship recipient.
Award(s) will be made for spring semester of the junior year, and be renewed for the students senior year as long as the student continued to meet eligibility criteria.
If selected as a recipient for this scholarship, please note the following:
Prior to disbursing your award, it is imperative that a “thank you” letter, a brief biography and an appropriate head shot be submitted via AcademicWorks.*
Questions- contact the Office of Scholarships at scholarships@fiu.edu. more...

Captrust Scholarship
We believe that empowering and preparing the next generation of professionals is critical for the economic vitality of our communities.
We are pleased to announce The CAPTRUST Scholarship!
Applications will open this fall (September 2022), with the scholarships being awarded for the Spring 2023 semester. We will select five students across the country to receive $1,000 each. At CAPTRUST, we believe it is essential to support our local communities and prepare developing professionals for success.
Essay Submission
In order to be considered for our scholarship, students must submit an essay response for each of the four categories outlined below. Responses must be 200 words or less, with a maximum of 800 words per submission.
Personal Goals
Accomplishments
Career Goals
Community Impact
Microsoft Word and PDF file types are accepted.
To access and download The CAPTRUST Scholarship Complete Application Form: https://www.captrust.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/The-CAPTRUST-Scholarship-Complete-Application-2022.pdf
Personal Goals
Describe your personality, interests, and values. Paint a clear picture of your personal passions and goals.
Accomplishments
Describe your accomplishments. These can include but are not limited to, personal, professional, academic, athletic, and advocacy achievements.
Career Goals
Describe your educational and career goals. Demonstrate how your major/educational path will help you reach those career goals.
Community Impact
Describe your community involvement activities. Share your positive impact in your local communities, which can include your school, work, religious, or other local community.
Academic Levels Considered
Incoming freshman
Freshman
Sophomore
Junior
Senior
All students are required to hold a current grade point average of 3.5 or higher.
The scholarship is also open to full-time employees working on an undergraduate degree.
Submission Materials & Permissions
Participants are required to submit:
College or high school transcript
Clear headshot
Completed application (includes essay responses)
To access and download The CAPTRUST Scholarship Complete Application form, please click here.
By submitting a headshot, the participant agrees that CAPTRUST is permitted use the image on the company’s social media pages, website, and throughout additional promotional material. Transcripts and completed applications will not be shared with the public.
Submission Process & Additional Information
All materials must be sent to scholarship@captrust.com. Incomplete submissions will not be considered. Please read all requirements thoroughly.
Deadline Closed Until September 2022
Any submissions received after November 30, 2022, will not be considered.
This scholarship is not eligible to family members of CAPTRUST employees.
Winners will be announced in January 2023.
If you have any additional questions regarding The CAPTRUST Scholarship or the submission process, please contact us at scholarship@captrust.com. more...

Cardenas Family First Generation Endowed Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
The purpose of the scholarship is to award to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida.
Criteria
Applicant must be enrolled at the University as an undergraduate student
Applicant must be a first generation college student.
Applicant must be a Florida resident.
Applicant must demonstrate financial need based upon guidelines set forth in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Preference will be given to students in the College of Business Administration.
If these preferences cannot be met, the funds will go to low-income first generation students.
This Scholarship, to the extent funds are available, will be used to pay for tuition, textbooks, fees, and any other items included in the cost of education. more...

Carmellina Borges, Rn And Victor Borges, Md, Clinical Fellowship Endowment
This fellowship was created in 2016 by Dr. Victor Borges in memory of his late wife, Carmellina, who worked as a RN for many years. This need-based fellowship is to support graduate students who are enrolled in one of the clinical degree doctoral programs in healthcare with first preference given to a student in the Doctoral of Nurse Practitioner in Family Practice degree program, have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. Regardless of nationality, the fellowship will be awarded to students who were born in India, or at least one parent born in India, with preference given to students who were born in the state of Goa, India or have at least one parent who was born in the state of Goa, India. Student must complete a FAFSA and demonstrate financial need as defined by the University’s Office of Financial Aid. more...

Carnival Gold Scholarship
Carnival Gold Scholarship Eligibility Criteria:
• Full-time undergraduate student that will graduate from a Florida high school in 2022
• Admitted in FIU’s Chaplin School of Hospitality and Tourism Management for Summer 2022/Fall 2022
• Minimum 3.5 GPA
• Must demonstrate financial need by completing FAFSA (https://fafsa.ed.gov/)
• Students must be a citizen of the United States or a U.S. lawful permanent resident
Application questions:
• 1-2 page personal statement
• Resume
• Need statement
In-person interview for selected candidates
5 renewable, full-tuition scholarships (including tuition/fees, room & board, books, academic tutoring, etc) of up to $20,000/year ($80,000/max)
Students must also make an appointment to meet with the Chaplin School of Hospitality’s Career Development Office once they have been offered an award for disbursement of award.
Questions- contact the Office of Scholarships at scholarships@fiu.edu. To learn more, visit: https://hospitality.fiu.edu/carnival/. more...

Chevron First Generation Scholarship
Recipients must demonstrate financial need by completing the national Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and be eligible for a Pell Grant.
Recipients must be the first generation in their family to attain a college bachelor’s degree (students whose siblings have attained or are pursuing a degree are also eligible).
Recipients must be residents of the state of Florida.
Recipients must be enrolled in or accepted for admission to the university and be a degree-seeking undergraduate student enrolled for a minimum of six credit hours per semester.
Minimum 3.3 GPA

Must be pursuing a degree that is beneficial to Chevron business ( in the College of Engineering)
Must demonstrate knowledge and interest in Chevron and energy industry
A minimum of 1 noteworthy achievement/recognition (Dean’s List, etc)
Additional requirements by class:
_ Freshman/Sophomore:_
A minimum of 1 membership in a technical society or extra-curricular activity (ex. Society of Women Engineers, Fraternity/Sorority, etc.)
A minimum of 1 Energy related internship OR non-technical work experience preferred, but not required
* Juniors/Senior:*
A minimum of 1 leadership role in a technical society or extra-curricular activity (ex. Society of Women Engineers, Fraternity/Sorority, etc.)
A minimum of 1 technical internship related to field of study
Graduating seniors should have intentions to seek a graduate degree immediately following graduation
Questions? Contact Laura Castillo at lccasti@fiu.edu. more...

Citizens Bank Scholarship
Give your college fund a lift with just one easy form. Enter to win below!
Ready to Boost Your College Fund
No essays, no report cards—just a couple of easy steps, and you’re entered. The Citizens Scholarship is giving away $2,500 every month to students and parents. If you don’t win this month, you could win next month and you’re automatically entered for the annual grand prize of $15,000. With all that, you’re made ready for success.
Citizens want to honor the dedication of students and families pursuing higher learning!
Fill out the registration form below to be entered for a chance to win a Grand Prize of $15,000 to use towards school expenses and one of the $2,500 monthly prizes!
Additionally, each quarter a student who meets the required criteria for the Minority Scholarship Prize will be eligible to win a $2,500 quarterly prize. See Official Rules for details.
How do I enter the Citizens Scholarship Sweepstakes?
Entering the Sweepstakes is easy! Simply fill out the form at our website in its entirety and submit. That’s it.
How often can I apply for the Sweepstakes, and does it increase my chances of winning?
There is a limit of one entry per person per month. You are not required to enter each month as for any month you are not selected as a winner, your entry will continue to roll into subsequent monthly drawings, as well as the Annual Grand Prize drawing of $15,000 to be awarded in July 2022.
What is the prize and where do you send it?
All entries received apply to monthly awards of $2,500 from 5/1/2021 through 6/30/2022 including entry into the Annual Grand Prize of $15,000 awarded in July 2022. Prize money will be sent directly to the school.
Who is eligible to enter the Sweepstakes?
This Sweepstakes is open to high school seniors, undergrad, and graduate students as well as parents or sponsors of high school, undergrad or graduate students. Students must plan on attending college, or be currently enrolled at least half-time in an eligible, accredited undergrad/grad post-secondary institution. more...

Ckitchen Scholarships
What is the CKitchen Educational Funding Program?
The program is developed to assist high school students who plan to continue their education in college.
Scholarships are offered each year for full-time study at an accredited institution of the student’s choice.
The scholarship program is currently giving a $5,000 grant to an eligible student to aid continue his or her studies in the culinary arts or hospitality industries.
We wish to recognize current or future culinary arts students who are enrolled in a culinary arts program or who are majoring in Culinary Arts or Hospitality Management.
We welcome you to apply whether you have already started your secondary education or you are in the exciting process of selecting the perfect career.
Our scholarship has been designed to be inclusive and to help the next generation of enthusiastic chefs and restaurant managers, regardless of socioeconomic position or existing academic achievements.
scholarship, students must meet the following requirements:
Must be US citizens or permanent residents
Must be enrolled or planning to enroll in an accredited college or university in Fall 2022 or Spring of 2022.
Must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Students have to write a 500-700 word essay on any topic
All applications must be submitted to scolarships@ckitchen.com. more...

Clark Law Group Scholarship
Fall 2022 Applications Currently Open
As a legal firm that dedicates its time and resources to the fields of family law and personal injury, we regularly work with clients who are facing extremely challenging obstacles. It is because of this experience that our firm has become so passionate about extending a helping hand to our community.
Our Clark Law Group Scholarship provides a $1,000 award each semester to a student whose parent is actively serving or previously served in the United States military. We are honored to support families of military service members.
Our scholarship is limited for use to help with tuition, books, room and board, and other educational expenses.
Eligibility Requirements
To be considered for our Fall 2022 Clark Law Group Scholarship, applicants must meet the following requirements:
You are enrolled in an accredited U.S. college or university for the Fall 2022 semester as an undergraduate or graduate student
You are a citizen or permanent resident of the U.S.
You have a minimum GPA of 3.0
You are a child of a current or former military service member
Applying for Our Scholarship
Applicants who would like to apply for our scholarship must submit the following materials:
Proof of enrollment for the Fall 2022 semester
Proof of required GPA

Proof of military service by a student’s parent
Professional headshot
Contact information
We also ask all applicants to submit an essay (500-1000 words) that answers the following prompt:
How do you intend to serve the public with your higher education and future career?
Recipient Selection Criteria
Applications that meet all specified requirements will be reviewed by our scholarship team. To choose the award winner, our team will judge each application using the following criteria:
Addresses prompt clearly & fully
Provides high caliber writing
Originality
Creativity
Contact The Scholarship Team
If you have questions about the Clark Law Group Scholarship, please contact our team by emailing SCHOLARSHIP@CLGTX.COM more...

Cohen Family First Generation Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
The purpose of the scholarship is to assist first-generation undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida.
Recipients will be selected based on the following established criteria:
1. The applicant must be a first-generation college student.
2. The applicant must be a Florida resident.
3. Have attempted less 132 total credit hours
4. The applicant must be Pell eligible
5. The applicant must demonstrate financial need based upon guidelines set forth in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Cohen Family First Generation Scholarship
The Cohen Family First Generation Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a resident of Florida, be a first generation college student, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Collegedunia Student Essay Scholarship
With over 1,000,000 international students, the USA boasts the world’s highest international student population. International people made up around 5% of all students enrolled in higher education in the United States. On average, an international student enrolled in a full-time undergraduate program in the US spends around USD 35,000- USD 40,000 per year (~25.86 lakhs – 29.55 lakhs). Without a decent funding option available, studying in the USA can be extremely expensive for international students.
Since education in the United States is said to be the costliest, Collegedunia has launched the ‘$1000 Student Essay’ Scholarship for students who aspire to gain an extensive education from colleges in the US. While planning your study abroad, it is always a good practice to look for scholarships and sources of funding in your home country. Since prominent federal grants such as FAFSA are only available to domestic students in the US, only a handful of university scholarships and third-party funding sources are available once you have landed in the US.
Most international students can receive scholarships in their home country to study in the United States. Scholarships for Indian students in the US are also available, but most have a high number of applicants and hence, high competition. The Collegedunia Student Essay Scholarship has other perks apart from the obvious $1000 USD. The competition is comparatively lower, but it also has a simple and short application process.
Eligibility Criteria: Enrolled in undergraduate/postgraduate course in the reputed US educational institute
Declaration of Result: December 2022
More than half of Indian students studying abroad enroll themselves in USA educational institutions. Hence, all you need to do for the $1000 Scholarship is, meet the eligibility criteria, write an essay as per the guidelines and wait for the selection process to conclude.
Irrespective of whether you study in Canada, UK, or any other foreign country with a reputed education industry, there are certain expenses to be taken care of. Tuition fees and accommodation are the major contributors to expenses when estimating your budget to study in the USA.
Even though some scholarships like Fulbright cover expenses of tuition as well as student accommodation, most scholarships only tend to lessen the burden of your expenses by covering a portion or all of your tuition fee. Scholarships are merit-based and do not take into consideration your financial situation.
Eligibility Criteria for $1000 Essay Scholarship
The scholarship is available to all students who plan to pursue higher education in the United States. Students who have been granted admission to any accredited and recognized American university can avail the scholarship. However, preference will be given to candidates going to Ivy League colleges such as Harvard University, Princeton, University of Pennsylvania, Columbia University, etc.
Should be 18 years or older at the time of enrollment
Should be enrolled in an approved undergraduate/postgraduate course in the reputed US educational institute
Should submit a non-plagiarized, original essay including the following points:

Why do you want to study in the US?
Why do you need this scholarship?
How will it benefit you?
How are you better than other applicants?
How to Apply for $1000 Essay Scholarship
Applying for Collegedunia $1000 Essay Scholarship is quite easy. All you need to do is fill out the scholarship form thoroughly and write a minimum 200-word essay on “Why do you need this scholarship?” The entries will be accepted from January 10, 2022.
The application is in online mode only. Hence, no offline forms are available.
Personal details such as name, contact information, education qualification, and background details are a must fill
A short original essay has to be written on the topic given by Collegedunia.com. It will be the main criteria for selection.
The word limit should not exceed more than 500 words and should not be less than 200 words
Your write-up should be up to the mark with correct spellings, correct punctuation and grammar, and proper sentence formation.
There will be no provision to edit/change your answer once it is submitted.
If the write up is found to be obscene, pornographic, libelous, targeting religious sentiments, or otherwise objectionable will stand disqualified
Once you are done with your write-up, proofread it and enter submit. more...

Renewable. more...

Community Foundation For Brevard Scholarship Program
Introduction
The Community Foundation for Brevard Scholarship awards are made possible by revenue generated from
The Community Scholarship Fund and will be awarded to college attendees who graduated from a Brevard
County high school.
Established in 2018 by a visionary anonymous donor, the endowed Community Scholarship Fund provides
financial aid for deserving Brevard County residents pursuing post-secondary education, with priority for
students who will be the first in their families to earn a bachelor’s degree.
Upon completion of the first year, scholarship recipients may apply for a second year scholarship.
Both the amount and number of scholarships will be recommended by a review committee with final
approval by the Foundation’s Board of Directors.
To qualify for the Community Foundation for Brevard
Scholarship Fund, you must meet the following criteria:
This scholarship may be used at any accredited college or university.
Scholarship is to be used for tuition, books, lab fees and/or campus-based room and board.
Priority will be given to students who are first in their families to earn a bachelor’s degree.
The applicant must have completed at least ONE year of college with a GPA equivalent average
of “B” or higher.
• The applicant must demonstrate a need for financial assistance.
• Eligibility for this scholarship is based upon residency and preference will be given for those who
attended a Brevard County high school or who have lived in Brevard for more than a year.
• The applicant must attach three letters of recommendation. Recommendations may not be
submitted by family members.
• It is understood that all scholarship checks will be paid directly to the institution of learning in
which the recipient is enrolled.
Required Essay: Typed, single spaced, 12-pt font
Describe where you see yourself in the next 5 (or 10) years. Please include both your
career and personal aspirations, and how you plan on serving the community. more...

Corey D. Dahlem Memorial Endowed Scholarships
Recipient must be a student in the College of Criminology and Criminal Justice who has completed their sophomore year with a minimum 2.75 GPA, is in good standing, has not been convicted of any alcohol-related offense, reckless driving or any type of driving or operating under the influence (DUI/DWI) charge and demonstrates financial need. First preference will be given to a natural or adopted child of any current sworn law enforcement officer with the Gainesville Police Department. Second preference will be given to the natural or adopted child of any current sworn law enforcement officer with the Alachua County Sheriff’s Office. Third preference will be given to the natural or adopted child of any current sworn law enforcement officer with the University of Florida Police Department. Fourth preference will be given to the natural or adopted child of any current sworn law enforcement agency in Pinellas County, FL. Fifth preference will be given to the natural or adopted child of any current sworn law enforcement officer or agent in any Federal or State of Florida agency (including, but not limited to, FBI, ATF, DEA, FDLE, FMP, and FHP). Sixth preference will be given to the natural or adopted child of any former sworn law enforcement officer who was employed by any local, city, county, or state law enforcement agency in the State of Florida. Seventh preference will be given to a student pursuing a degree in law enforcement. Eighth preference will be given to a student who is a Florida resident majoring in criminology and criminal justice. Ninth preference will be given to a student who is not a Florida resident majoring in criminology and criminal justice. more...

Couponbirds "Help To Save" Scholarship
About CouponBirds
CouponBirds is the No.1 coupon site in terms of coupon validation rate, valid coupon code numbers, and store coverage. Saving money is always worth the effort. CouponBirds has also developed a smarter money-saving assistant called CouponBirds SmartCoupon Finder to help more people save easily and quickly.
CouponBirds “Help to Save” Scholarship
CouponBirds has launched the “Help to Save” scholarship for high school and college students who need help with their tuition fees. Firstly, this program requires the participants to upload a 2-3 minute video (no longer than 5 minutes). Secondly, participants are required to post on Twitter or Facebook with information related to saving money with CouponBirds SmartCoupon Extension. Individuals with the best idea and response will be selected to give a presentation at our site, last but not least, the person with the most creative idea will win the grand prize.
CouponBirds $2,000 Scholarship Prize
2022 CouponBirds $2,000 Scholarship Prize will be awarded to 3 winners.
There are 2 levels:
The First Prize for $1,000, 1 winner;
The Second Prize for $500, 2 winners.
Steps to Apply
Fill out the required information.
Install CouponBirds SmartCoupon Finder at Chrome/Firefox/Edge. Click Here.
Subscribe to CouponBirds’ social media channel.
Upload your video to YouTube with the title “Save Money with CouponBirds SmartCoupon Extension”, add a link(https://www.couponbirds.com/smartcoupon) of CouponBirds SmartCoupon Extension Introduction Page in the video description. Describe your video in simple words.
Post your user experience with CouponBirds SmartCoupon Finder on Twitter or Facebook, add a hashtag #CouponBirdsSmartCouponFinder and a link(https://www.couponbirds.com/smartcoupon) of CouponBirds SmartCoupon Finder Introduction Page.
Submit your application with one click at the bottom of the application page.
Note
All six of these steps must be fully completed before the deadline of the application to be considered for the scholarship prize.
Application Deadline
The 2022 application deadline is October 10th, 2022. more...

Award for 2022-2023

Cure- Coulter Undergraduate Research Excellence Program
The purpose of Coulter Undergraduate Research Excellence Program (CURE) is to expose top undergraduate students to research experience and provide support to allow significant research activity and supplement Summer REU.
Applicant must have already completed and passed BME 1008 and have a 3.0 GPA.
When applying please select which tier best suits your interests and preparation.
Trainee
Undergraduate student with no previous research experience
Research volunteer
$150 per student for lab supplies
Researcher
One semester of Trainee Experience
$1,800 for the 12-week semester-long program paid in three equal installments
$350 per student for lab supplies
Fellow
Two semesters of research experience as a CURE Researcher
$2,160 for the 12-week semester-long program paid in three equal installments
$500 per student for lab supplies
If you have any questions regarding this program please contact Dr. Joshua Hutcheson at jhutches@fiu.edu. more...

Dayspring Pens Scholarship
Eligibility
Applicant must also meet the following criteria:
-Must be at least 18 years or older
-Must be a legal resident of the United States or a holder of a valid student visa
-Must be currently enrolled in or accepted to a full-time undergraduate and graduate program in an accredited US university or college
Application Process
For a chance to win the scholarship, write a 500-word essay about the following topic:
Name a fictional character that you connected with in the last year and describe how they have made a lasting impact on your life.
Essays must be sent to scholarship@dayspringpens.com as an attached word document, along with the following information:
-Full name
-Address
-Phone number
-Date of birth
-School name
-Major
-Expected graduation date (for high school seniors only)
-Use the subject line: Dayspring Pens Scholarship | (Your Full Name)
Terms and Conditions
Only one submission is allowed per applicant. You must present proof of your eligibility for the program based on the qualifications mentioned above.
By participating in this scholarship program, you allow Dayspring Pens to use your full name and essay for marketing purposes.
Send us your response following the guidelines above. A winner will be selected and notified via email on February 09, 2023. The winner should respond within 7 days of receipt; otherwise, another winner will be selected. more...

Ddrb Lawyers Legal Scholarship
The DDRB Lawyers Legal Scholarship by Dolan Dobrinsky Rosenblum Bluestein, LLP is a recurring scholarship worth $1500 designed to help one law student with their tuition costs.
We welcome all eligible students to apply and look forward to reviewing your application.
APPLICATION DEADLINE: JAN 31, 2023*
The winner will be announced on or before Mar 31, 2023.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS:
You must be admitted, or have received an acceptance letter, to an accredited law school in the U.S.
3.5 or higher current cumulative GPA. If you are an incoming 1L student, we will accept your undergraduate cumulative GPA.
If the law school you’re attending uses a pass-fail binary grade system, then we will accept a “pass”.
APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Completed Application. Incomplete or late applications will not be considered.
Upload a 400-500 word original essay on what you hope to achieve in your legal career if awarded this scholarship.
Upload an Unofficial School Transcript. Unofficial transcripts do not need to be sealed and can be uploaded as a PDF below.
Upload Resume.
Please do not call the firm regarding the scholarship. Failure to follow these simple instructions will result in your disqualification. If you have questions that are not answered above, please email ddrblawyers@gmail.com, and we will respond to you as soon as we can.
Thank you for your interest and good luck! more...

Dirk Derrick Car & Truck Accident Injury Scholarship
A $1,000 Scholarship For Those Affected By Auto Accidents
The Dirk Derrick Car & Truck Accident Injury Scholarship is an award for any current or soon-to-be undergraduate student in the United States who has had his or her life altered due to an injury from a car or truck accident, be it their own injury, that of a loved one, or an influential individual. The Dirk Derrick Scholarship has a brief submission process, and applicants will be judged on their ability to convey the lasting effect an auto accident has had on their life as well as their journey to overcome those challenges. Applicants may apply via the Google Form on our website.
Students applying must submit an essay where you explain, present, inspire, or otherwise convince us as to why you deserve to win this scholarship. There are no conditions or outside requirements for this essay. Please keep submissions to 5 paragraphs and 600 words at the absolute maximum. This is not a standardized test. While spelling, punctuation, and general cohesiveness will make your essay easier to read, and therefore judge, you are not being graded.
The winning submission will be one that clearly conveys a non-fictional story of your life before and after an auto accident.
Auto accidents can be life-changing. At The Derrick Law Firm, we believe in keeping the public safe by bringing the first-hand experience to those who haven’t had it, as well as easing the stress of accident victims as they enter one of the most important phases of their lives.
This is a one-time $1,000 scholarship and the winner will be announced on December 20th of each year. more...

Dr. Carolyn Williams History Research Award Endowment
The Dr. Carolyn Williams Research Award was established in honor of Dr. Carolyn Williams, Associate Professor of History at UNF until her passing in 2012. In 1975, Dr. Williams graduated from UNF with a BA in History, subsequently earning a Ph.D. at UCLA. She returned to Jacksonville, serving for more than two decades as a beloved member of UNF history faculty, where she specialized in U.S., women’s, African American, and local history, a subject about which she became fascinated in her later years.
The Department of History is seeking applications for the Dr. Carolyn Williams Research Award. Grants will provide [up to] $1500 to support original research on any historical topic. Undergraduate and graduate History majors are encouraged to apply. Applicants must have a minimum UNF GPA of 3.0 to be eligible for consideration. Please submit an application, consisting of the following:
• A research proposal (no more than 350 words) describing the nature of the project, its significance, and any work which has already been done by the applicant
• A brief bibliography of scholarship on the topic of the project
• A brief statement explaining how the project will be disseminated, e.g. publication in a journal, presentation at a conference, museum exhibition, on-line publication, submission to a class (note: plans can be tentative).
• A brief statement of support from a supervising faculty member or other professional (may be sent directly to Dr. Sheffler)
All application materials should be sent to Dr. David Sheffler (David.Sheffler@unf.edu) by February 15. Successful applicants will be notified by March 15.
If you have any questions please contact Dr. David Sheffler by email or telephone (904) 620-1856. more...

Recipients will be selected based on the following established criteria:
1. Applicant must be enrolled at the University in the College of Engineering and Computer Science.

Dr. Edna L. Saffy Library Scholarship
Established in 2016, this scholarship provides funding for students majoring in history, philosophy or political science; or minoring in gender studies.
The purpose of the Dr. Edna L. Saffy Library Scholarship, value $1,000, is to provide support for a student with an academic interest in women’s history.  Preference will be given to students with an interest in (ascending order of priority) American Women’s History, Florida Women’s History, Jacksonville Women’s History, and/or Dr. Edna Saffy’s contribution to Women’s History. Dr. Edna L. Saffy was a professor, human rights activist and founder of NOW chapters in Jacksonville and Gainesville. She was active in city, county, state and national political causes.  As Gloria Steinem said of her, “Edna always makes it happen.” more...

Dr. Hulon And Dinah Crayton Endowed Scholarship
Recipient must be a degree-seeking student attending Florida State University at the Panama City campus. Recipient must possess and maintain a minimum 2.5 FSU GPA, be enrolled in at least 6 credit hours and demonstrate financial need. First priority for awarding of the scholarship shall be to qualified students who are enrolled in the School of Nursing. If there are no such applicants, the scholarship may be awarded to qualified applicants enrolled in any undergraduate degree program offered at FSU Panama City. If at any time in the future undergraduate programs in the curriculum area of health/medical sciences are established at FSU Panama City, it is understood that the first priority of awarding of the scholarship shall be amended to a qualified student enrolled in one of the health/medical sciences programs.
One of the purposes of this scholarship is to increase diversity at Florida State University. Any student may apply to be considered for the award; however, it is the preference of the donor that the recipient be a minority student. more...

Eddy M Skolfield Scholarship Fund
Established in 2000, this gift provides scholarships for science students interested in biology, ultimately leading to a medical profession. Dr. Eddy Skolfield, who died just three days before her 100th birthday, immigrated to the United States after World War II and worked with a group of pediatric physicians led by Dr. Richard Skinner of Jacksonville. She practiced in Indonesia, Guam and at Hope Haven Children’s Hospital. more...

Edward A And Beryl A Johnson Study Abroad Business Endowed Scholarship
Established in 2012, this gift was initiated by Ed and Beryl Johnson to provide scholarship assistance to business students who are interested in learning about the challenges of doing business across international and cultural divides. Ed served as a former dean of the Coggin College of Business, and Beryl taught courses for the college. The Johnsons’ goal was to instill intellectual curiosity in business students to help guide their educational choices and inspire them to think about business through an international context. more...

Elaine Gordon Scholarship
Award for 2022-2023
Trailblazer . . Feminist . . Champion of human rights.
These are the words that best describe Elaine Gordon.
The Elaine Gordon Scholarship program was established in 2000 to honor the life and work of Elaine Gordon, a former state legislator who, for 22 years, championed equal rights for women.
To be considered for this award, a student must:
•Be fully admitted in the College of Arts, Sciences, and Education as a Women’s and Gender Studies Major or Certificate earner.
•Have completed or be enrolled in a minimum of 9 credit hours of Women’s and Gender Studies courses.
•Be enrolled as an undergraduate student at the time of application.
•Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
•Financial need will be one consideration in awarding the scholarship.
•Undergraduates with at least two semesters of study (not including summer) remaining are eligible. more...
