Elite Lawyer Scholarship
Now Accepting Applications for Fall 2022
At Elite Lawyer, we recognize high-achieving attorneys who have demonstrated a commitment to their communities and the legal profession. We are proud to support the next generation of leaders by once again sponsoring a scholarship for students pursuing higher education to make a difference in their own communities.
With the added economic and health challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, Elite Lawyer recognizes that today’s college students need support now more than ever. We encourage eligible students to enter for a chance to win a $1,000 scholarship toward your tuition or other educational expenses.
Who Can Apply?
You are eligible for the Fall 2022 Elite Lawyer Scholarship if:
You are currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited U.S. college or university
Your education will continue through at least the Fall 2022 semester
You are a U.S. citizen
You are at least 18 years old
You have a current GPA of at least 3.0
How to Apply
In order to be considered, you must submit either a 500-word essay or a 2-minute video presentation in response to the following question:
What positive change are you working to bring to your community this year?

Along with your essay or video, you must submit your name, date of birth, mailing address, email address, phone number, proof of enrollment, unofficial transcripts, and a professional photograph of yourself.
The deadline to apply is January 19, 2023, at 11:59 p.m. CST. Only one submission per applicant is allowed.
GO TO APPLICATION
Judging Criteria
Our selection committee will review all applications and select a winner based on:
A clear passion for making a difference in your community
Quality of communication, including organization and clarity
Thoughtfulness, originality, and creativity
The winner will be notified by August 1, 2022, and the award will be sent to the financial aid office at the winner’s college or university. Scholarship winners consent to the use of their name, likeness, and essay or video on our website and other Elite Lawyer marketing channels. more...

Energyrates.Ca College Scholarship
EnergyRates.Ca College Scholarship 2023
The energy industry has always lived with one foot in the present and the other in the future. With many major projects—power plants, dams, pipelines—having development times measured in decades, success depends upon anticipating the needs of companies and countries in the years ahead.
We look forward to seeing what the next great minds bring to this ever-transforming industry, and want to do our part in assisting those great minds to achieve their goals and dreams. This is why Energy Rates is offering a $500 scholarship to any student enrolled in an American or Canadian post-secondary educational institution. Whether you need to pay for your classes or textbooks, or just to put food on the table this semester, it’s yours to do with as you please. All you have to do to be considered for the scholarship is write an essay, no more than 500 words in length, telling us where you see the future of the energy industry.
Scholarship Essay Prompt
You can talk about anything you want—green energy, oil politics, the continued use of nuclear power, your personal ideas and innovations—so long as it’s about energy in the world of tomorrow. What do you think people will be reading about in the news in a few years?
Technical Details
The deadline for entry submission is January 31, 2023. Any submissions submitted after 11:59 PM MST on January 31st will not be eligible for consideration.
Essays must be submitted in one of the following document formats: Microsoft Word (DOC, DOCX), Rich Text File (RTF), or Adobe Acrobat (PDF).
Please use a standard, easily read font, such as Times New Roman, Arial, Calibri, etc.
To submit your entry, please use the submission form below. All fields must be filled in–name, email address, and current address. Do NOT forget to attach your essay to your submission.
EnergyRates.Ca Scholarship Entry Rules and Requirements
Please note, failure to meet all of the requirements listed below may result in disqualification.
Applicants must be enrolled in an American or Canadian post-secondary educational institution or planning to enroll in such an institution within the following calendar year.
The subject of the essay must fall within the parameters described above.
The essay must be written in English or French, and have a length of no more than 500 words (not including title, applicant name, etc).
The scholarship funds must be used for some education-related expenses, such as tuition, books, school fees, room, and board, etc.
The winner of the scholarship grants EnergyRates.Ca non-exclusive publication rights to their essay so that we can feature their winning essay on our scholarship site.
EnergyRates.Ca reserves the right to select a panel of judges and scoring methodology at its own discretion. more...

Students must be teaching assistants for the 1000-2000 level or the 3000 level or above and demonstrate excellent preparation of discussions/laboratory exercises. Due date may vary. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Florida Atlantic University Christine E. Lynn College of Nursing. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Estelle Cawthon Starling & W. Winston Starling, Jr. Endowed Scholarship Fund
Recipient must be an undergraduate student with a minimum 2.8 GPA whose scholarly work is focused in Arts and Sciences or Business. Preference will be given to a student that has already completed their first two years of college and is from Bay, Walton or Washington County, FL. more...

Estelle Cawthon Starling Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Recipient must be a student at Florida State University Panama City and have been a resident of Bay or Walton County, Florida for a minimum of 10 years. Applicant must be enrolled for a minimum of 6 credit hours, possess a 2.8 GPA and maintain a 2.5 GPA during the award period. Primary consideration will be demonstrated financial need. more...

Financial Assistance Program (Fap): Active Duty
Available to physicians at any point during their residency training, must be PGY1 complete (restrictions apply):
Paid monthly stipend of approximately $2,500.00*
Student loan payback*
Accession Bonus*
Contact us to Apply!

Scholarship for Duval, Nassau, St. Johns, Baker, or Clay County, Florida residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Pharmacy. First Generation Burnett College Of Biological Sciences Scholarship
The First Generation Burnett College of Biological Sciences Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida who are majoring in a biological science.. You must be a first generation college student and be a Florida resident to be eligible for this award. more...

First Generation Burnett Honors College Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria:
1. Applicant must be enrolled at least half-time (6 credits) as an undergraduate student at UCF.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

First Generation Burnett Honors College Scholarship
The First Generation Burnett Honors College Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida-Honors College. You must be a first generation college student, be a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Criteria

7. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

First Generation Matching Grant Award
The First Generation Matching Grant Award is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

First Generation Matching Grant Award
This scholarship is for the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters
This application is for consideration for the First Generation Matching Grant Program and all of the associated first generation scholarships.
Grant criteria, but not limited to:
1. Applicant must be enrolled at least half-time (6 credits) as an undergraduate student at UCF.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
For more information regarding the First Generation Matching Grant visit the office of Student Financial website: https://www.ucf.edu/financial-aid/types/grants/first-generation-matching/ more...

First Generation Rosen College Of Hospitality Management
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria
1. Applicant must be enrolled at least half-time (6 credits) as an undergraduate student at UCF in the Rosen College of Hospitality Management.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Fiu College Board Recognition Program Scholarships
Students awarded any of the below recognition awards from the College Board will be eligible to apply and compete for a scholarship from FIU equal to full tuition, fees, books, and a $1,000 meal plan stipend per semester. Recipients will also receive guaranteed admission to the Honors College and early registration.
Eligibility Requirements:
Entering FIU as a First-Time-in-College student during the Early Fall 2023 or Fall 2023 term
US Citizen or eligible non-citizen
4.0 weighted HS GPA as re-calculated by FIU

1370 SAT Score or 30 ACT or Top 5% of a Florida Highschool Graduating Class
Awarded one of the following recognition awards below from the College Board (African American Recognition, Hispanic Recognition, Indigenous Recognition, Rural and Small Town Recognition)
Students be admitted to FIU by November 1, 2022. Application deadline is November 14, 2022
This award cannot be stacked with Raise.Me, Gold & Blue or other FIU scholarships; but can be stacked with Federal & State scholarships and aid up to the annual cost of attendance. For questions please contact:
Office of Scholarships
scholarships@fiu.edu
305-348-0349 more...

Fiu Community College Honors Scholarship

Students must have a minimum 3.3 GPA, be Associate of Arts graduates, and participate in Florida International University Honors College. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Fiu Foreverglades Scholarship
The FIU ForEverglades scholarships are open to full-time graduate research students from Florida International University (FIU) pursuing degrees in sciences and engineering. Cross-disciplinary research efforts are of special interest. Only graduate students from FIU are welcome to apply for the FIU ForEverglades Scholarship. The scholarships will be awarded to full-time graduate students enrolled in or accepted for admission to FIU who are pursuing Everglades restoration-related research in the Institute of Environment.
FIU ForEverglades scholarships provide up to $25,000 for stipends, travel, and other research related expenses. The number of scholarships and award amount depends on the number and quality of applications. The duration of this scholarship is set for 12 months.
The application for The Everglades Foundation ForEverglades Scholarship should contain the following:
A 1 page cover letter (student’s name, university, department, advisor, proposal title, scholarship program of interest, contact information, and document list).
Proposal describing the research that the scholarship would support (no more than 5,000 words including bibliography). The proposal is to clearly emphasize the expected contributions to Everglades research and relevance to Everglades restoration.
Research budget and itemized justification detailing the proposed expenditure from scholarship.
Timeline of proposed research activities.
A personal essay of no more than 2 pages on the candidate’s career goals and how the scholarship will support those goals and contributions.
A curriculum vitae.
Academic transcripts (unofficial transcripts are allowed).
Other relevant or supporting work products or documentation (such as published papers, presentations, awards, etc.) could optionally be included.
A letter of reference from the student’s major professor including student’s status in the graduate program (admitted, candidacy).
Two other academic/professional letters of reference (preferably from investigator(s) currently engaged in Everglades research
For more information, click “Visit” below. more...

Fiu Mle-Tesol Award
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at Florida International University College of Education. Students must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and demonstrate commitment to the advancement of language education and social justice. Preference given to students in the Masters International Program and non-Florida residents. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Fiu Online Academic Merit Scholarship
FIU Online has established the Academic Merit Scholarship to award a limited number of students who exhibit strong academic credentials upon admission.
The FIU Online Academic Merit Scholarship is an award of $2,000, divided and disbursed over the first 3 semesters in equal installments.
To qualify for the scholarship, applicants must be new admitted students for the Fall 2022 semester in any of the below fully online or hybrid programs.
Scholarship recipient selection is competitive, and students are encouraged to apply early.
Eligible Fully Online and Hybrid Programs:
1. Online Master of Science in Engineering Management
2. Online Master of Science in Computer Engineering: Network Security
3. Online Master of Science in Hospitality Management
4. Online Master of Public Health
5. Online or Hybrid Master of Health Services Administration
6. Online Master of Science in Higher Education Administration
7. Online Master of Science Educational Leadership
8. Online Master of Science Curriculum and Instruction
9. Online Master of Science in Special Education: Autism Endorsement
10. Online Master of Science in Research Design and Analysis
11. Online Master of Science in Foreign Language Education: Teaching in Challenging Contexts
Eligibility:
1. Be a fully admitted new student in the above-mentioned programs.
2. Minimum 3.25 GPA in upper-division undergraduate coursework based on transcript evaluation.
3. Maintain continuous enrollment each semester.
4. Scholarship application must be submitted by the program application deadline.
5. This application is for new students starting their program Fall 2022.
Notes:
This scholarship opportunity is for new students beginning in the Fall 2022 semester. If you are beginning your program in a later semester, please check the FIU Academic Works website (https://fiu.academicworks.com) later to look for the scholarship opportunity for your beginning semester.
Meeting any or all of the above requirements does not guarantee receipt of a scholarship.
Scholarship amounts are subject to change.
The award will be distributed and disbursed over the first 3 semesters in equal installments, after the add/drop date and tuition payment due date of each semester.
Scholarship requires continuous full-time enrollment (part-time enrollment for flexible programs) and students must maintain a cumulative 3.0 GPA in the admitted program.
Scholarships are non-transferable.
Students who are recipients of the FIU Online Corporate and Community Scholarship or the FIU Online GET STARTED Scholarship are not eligible for the FIU Online Academic Merit Scholarship. more...

Fiu Online Corporate And Community Scholarship
FIU Online has established the Corporate and Community Scholarship to award a limited number of students who are employees or members of select industry organizations.
This scholarship is eligible to students who are:
Employees of companies which are partners of FIU Online
Employees of organizations making an impact in communities and industries
Members or participants of professional industry organizations which are partners of FIU Online
The FIU Online Corporate and Community Scholarship is an award of $2,000, divided and disbursed over the first 3 semesters in equal installments.
To qualify for the scholarship, applicants must be new admitted students for the Fall 2022 semester in any of the below fully online or hybrid programs.
Scholarship recipient selection is competitive, and students are encouraged to apply early.
Eligible Fully Online and Hybrid Programs:
1. Online Master of Science in Engineering Management
2. Online Master of Science in Computer Engineering: Network Security
3. Online Master of Science in Hospitality Management
4. Online Master of Public Health
5. Online or Hybrid Master of Health Services Administration
6. Online Master of Science in Higher Education Administration
7. Online Master of Science Educational Leadership
8. Online Master of Science Curriculum and Instruction
9. Online Master of Science in Special Education: Autism Endorsement
10. Online Master of Science in Research Design and Analysis
11. Online Master of Science in Foreign Language Education: Teaching in Challenging Contexts
Eligibility:
1. Be a fully admitted new student in the above-mentioned programs
2. Maintain continuous enrollment each semester
3. Scholarship application must be submitted by the program application deadline
4. This application is for new students starting their program Fall 2022.
Notes:
This scholarship opportunity is for new students beginning in the Fall 2022 semester. If you are beginning your program in a later semester, please check the FIU Academic Works website later to look for the scholarship opportunity for your beginning semester.
Meeting any or all of the above requirements does not guarantee receipt of a scholarship.
Scholarship amounts are subject to change.
The award will be distributed and disbursed over the first 3 semesters in equal installments, after the add/drop date and tuition payment due date of each semester.
Scholarship requires continuous full-time enrollment (part-time enrollment for flexible programs) and students must maintain a cumulative 3.0 GPA in the admitted program.
Scholarships are non-transferable.
Students who are recipients of the FIU Online Academic Merit Scholarship or the FIU Online GET STARTED Scholarship are not eligible for the FIU Online Corporate and Community Scholarship.
Essay:
Please provide a 1 to 2 page essay answering the following question: How will your degree help you advance your industry?
Employer or Organization Verification
In order to verify employment or membership, student must provide the below information. By providing this information, student authorizes FIU to contact employer to verify employment or organization to verify membership or participation.
Student Information:
1. First Name
2. Last Name
3. Position at Company / Organization
4. Department at Company / Organization
5. Company / Organization Email
6. Company / Organization Phone Number
Employer / Organization Information:
1. Name of Company / Organization
2. Company / Organization Website
3. First and Last Name of HR Contact or Organization Contact:
4. Email of HR Contact or Organization Contact
5. Phone Number of HR Contact or Organization Contact more...

Fiu Online Get Started Scholarship
FIU Online has established the GET STARTED Scholarship to support students who may be challenged with hardships due to the impact of COVID-19.
The FIU Online GET STARTED Scholarship is an award of $1,000, provided once during the Fall 2022 semester.
To qualify for the scholarship, applicants must be new admitted students for the Fall 2022 semester in any of the below fully online or hybrid programs.
Scholarship is limited and students are encouraged to apply early.
Eligible Fully Online and Hybrid Programs:
1. Online Master of Science in Engineering Management
2. Online Master of Science in Computer Engineering: Network Security
3. Online Master of Science in Hospitality Management
4. Online Master of Public Health
5. Online or Hybrid Master of Health Services Administration
6. Online Master of Science in Higher Education Administration
7. Online Master of Science Educational Leadership
8. Online Master of Science Curriculum and Instruction
9. Online Master of Science in Special Education: Autism Endorsement
10. Online Master of Science in Research Design and Analysis
11. Online Master of Science in Foreign Language Education: Teaching in Challenging Contexts
Eligibility:
1. Be a fully admitted new student in the above-mentioned programs.
2. Scholarship application must be submitted by the scholarship application deadline.
3. This application is for students starting their program Fall 2022.
Note: Meeting any or all of the above requirements does not guarantee receipt of a scholarship. The award will be disbursed in the Summer 2022 semester. Scholarships are non-transferable.
Notes:
This scholarship opportunity is for new students beginning in the Fall 2022 semester. If you are beginning your program in a later semester, please check the FIU Academic Works website (https://fiu.academicworks.com/) later to look for the scholarship opportunity for your beginning semester.
Meeting any or all of the above requirements does not guarantee receipt of a scholarship.
Scholarship amounts are subject to change.
The award will be disbursed in the Fall 2022 semester, after the add/drop date and tuition payment due date of each semester.
Scholarships are non-transferable.
Students who are recipients of the FIU Online Academic Merit Scholarship or the FIU Online Corporate and Community Scholarship are not eligible for the FIU Online GET STARTED Scholarship. more...

Fiu Online New Year, New Motivation Scholarship
Being an educator is challenging, but so rewarding! The start of 2022 is an opportunity to renew motivation for a cause that deeply impacts our communities: EDUCATION.
With the challenges faced by educators in 2021, FIU Online at Florida International University is awarding the NEW YEAR, NEW MOTIVATION SCHOLARSHIP as we take on the 2022 year.
This is a $5,000 scholarship which will be awarded to one educator with the interest of developing themselves in critical areas, including, curriculum and instruction, educational leadership, and special education.
The FIU Online New Year, New Motivation Scholarship is an award of $5,000, divided and disbursed over the first three semesters, in equal installments, after the add/drop date and tuition payment due date of each semester.
To qualify for the scholarship, applicants must be new admitted students during the Fall 2022 semester in any of the below fully online education programs.
Eligible Fully Online Programs:
Online Master of Science in Curriculum and Instruction: Curriculum Development
Online Master of Science in Curriculum and Instruction: Elementary Education
Online Master of Science in Educational Leadership
Online Master of Science in Foreign Language Education: Teaching in Challenging Contexts
Online Master of Science in Higher Education Administration
Online Master of Science in Special Education: Autism Endorsement
Online Master of Science in Research Design and Development
Eligibility:
Be a fully admitted new student in the above-mentioned programs.
Scholarship application must be submitted by the program application deadline.
This application is for new students starting their program Fall 2022.
Note: Meeting any or all of the above requirements does not guarantee receipt of a scholarship. Scholarships are non-transferable.
Notes:
This scholarship opportunity is for new students beginning in the Fall 2022 semester.
Meeting any or all of the above requirements does not guarantee receipt of a scholarship.
Scholarship amounts are subject to change.
The award will begin disbursement in the Fall 2022 semester after the add/drop date and tuition payment due date of each semester.
Scholarships are non-transferable. more...

Florence Nightgale Scholarship
Applications for the 2022 HCD Nightingale Scholarship is open through September 15, 2022.
The ASQ Healthcare Division (HCD) is pleased to announce the 2022 Florence Nightingale Scholarship program.
Since 2009, HCD has awarded one scholarship annually, valued at $2,000 US, in honor of Florence Nightingale. Nightingale (1820-1910) was an English social reformer, statistician, and the founder of modern nursing.
The scholarship is open to all students who are United States citizens and actively enrolled in an accredited master’s, doctoral or post-graduate nursing program that is physically located in the United States.
Eligibility requirements include:
Be a student actively enrolled in a master’s, doctoral or post-graduate nursing program.
Pursuing studies related to healthcare quality in the nursing profession.
The college or university must be physically located in the United States, a U.S. permanent territory, state, or the District of Columbia.
The student must be a United States citizen.
The student must have a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 out of 4.0 or a “B” equivalent.
Please use the link for a complete list of requirements and to apply. more...

Florence W. Ruebush Endowment Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Journalism and Communications. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Florida A&M University-Army Rotc Room And Board Scholarship
Florida A&M University-Army ROTC Room and Board Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at Florida A&M University who are U.S. Citizens and have a minimum GPA of 3.0. You must be a recipient of the national ROTC scholarship or two-year scholarship at the time of enrollment, enroll in a program of study that meets the needs of the Armed Services, and be eligible to become a commissioned officer to qualify for this award. Selection will be based on demonstrated leadership, community service, participation in extracurricular activities, and academic merit. more...

Florida A&M University-George W. Gore Award
The Florida A&M University-George W. Gore Award is available to incoming freshman students at Florida A&M University who exhibit high ideas and scholastic achievement. You must have a minimum 3.75 GPA, 1330 SAT or 29 ACT, and have earned a minimum score of 76 on the ALEKS Math exam for Engineering, Physical, Life, Natural and Computer Sciences majors (all others must earn at least a 61 on the ALEKS Math exam) to be eligible for this award. In addition, you must be a U.S. resident or permanent resident. Selected recipients are expected to maintain the specific enrollment program under which the award was made and enroll in 15 credit hours per semester. Award is renewable for a maximum of eight semesters provided the conditions outlined on the scholarship requirements page are met. more...

Florida A&M University-Navy Rotc Room And Board Scholarship
The Florida A&M University-Navy ROTC Room and Board Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at Florida A&M University who are U.S. Citizens and have a minimum GPA of 3.0. You must be a recipient of the national ROTC scholarship or two-year scholarship at the time of enrollment, enroll in a program of study that meets the needs of the Armed Services, and be eligible to become a commissioned officer to qualify for this award. Selection will be based on demonstrated leadership, community service, participation in extracurricular activities, and academic merit. more...

Florida A&M University-President's Special Scholarship
The Florida A&M University-President's Special Scholarship is available to incoming freshman students at Florida A&M University who are diverse and have special talents outside of the classroom setting. You must have a minimum GPA of 3.5, 1220 SAT or 27 ACT, and have earned a minimum score of 76 on the ALEKS Math exam for Engineering, Physical, Life, Natural and Computer Sciences majors (all others must earn at least a 61 on the ALEKS Math exam) to be eligible for this award. Selected recipients are expected to maintain the specific enrollment program under which the award was made and enroll in 15 credit hours per semester. Award is renewable for a maximum of eight semesters provided the conditions outlined on the scholarship requirements page are met. more...

Florida Blue Center For Ethics Scholarship
Established in 2002, the Florida Blue Center for Ethics Scholarship is to provide scholarship funding for University of North Florida students to participate in University-approved transformational learning experiences focusing on ethical issues as they emerge in personal, public, and professional life. These experiences can include working on an undergraduate research project; traveling to present research or compete in conferences regionally and internationally, participating in an ethics focused internship, and/or other faculty-approved activities. more...

Florida Farmworker Student Scholarship Program
Hello students!
The Office of Scholarships would like to share with you an opportunity you may be eligible for. The Florida Farmworker Student Scholarship (FFSS) Program is a need-based merit scholarship that provides financial assistance to a maximum of 50 eligible students who are farmworkers (or children of farmworkers), as defined in section 420.503, Florida Statutes.
Eligibility – The student will:
• Be a Florida resident
• Earn a minimum weighted cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.5 for all high school courses creditable toward a diploma
• Complete a minimum of 30 service hours
• As documented on the student’s transcript, the student must:
Have a minimum 90% attendance rate; and,
Have no disciplinary action brought against him or her.
• Be a farmworker or child of a farmworker. For the definition of a Farmworker, please visit: https://www.floridastudentfinancialaidsg.org/PDF/factsheets/FFSS.pdf
Requirements to Receive Funding – The student will:
• Be a Florida resident and a U.S. citizen or eligible non-citizen. A student’s residency and citizenship status are determined by the postsecondary institution. Questions regarding such status should be directed to the financial aid office or admissions office of the institution the student plans to attend.
• Enroll in a minimum of 12 credit hours per term, or the equivalent, at an eligible participating public postsecondary institution in a program of study leading to an undergraduate degree or a career certificate.
Applying for an Award:
Submit an error-free Florida Financial Aid Application
For more regulations and award information, visit: https://www.floridastudentfinancialaidsg.org/SAPHome/SAPHome
If you have any questions or concerns, email: scholarships@fiu.edu. Thank you! more...

Florida-Georgia Louis Stokes Alliance For Minority Participation In Science, Engineering And Mathematics At Fiu (Fglsamp)
The FGLSAMP Scholarship program at FIU provides scholarships in the amount of $1,050 per term, Fall and Spring, totaling $2,100 per year up to 5 years, ending once they graduate. Scholarship recipients are required to be active members of research labs, attend professional development workshops, complete progress reports, and do an oral or poster presentation at the annual FGLSAMP EXPO or another conference of their choice.
Eligible students must be a fully admitted undergraduate student at FIU majoring in:
Electrical Eng, Civil Eng, Mechanical Eng, Environmental Eng, Computer Eng, Biomedical Eng, Computer Science/Technology, Information Technology, Chemistry, Math, Statistics, Physics, Biology, or Geology.
Requirements:
Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident (proof of residency required)
Must have a G.P.A. of 2.8 or higher
Must be a fully admitted, first-time undergraduate at FIU, and registered for full-time (12 credits minimum) each Fall and Spring term.
Must apply for FAFSA and qualify for Financial Aid at FIU each year while in the program
Must be following the curriculum for the chosen (STEM) major
Recipient must provide academic information to the program coordinator on request, to show the student progress while in the program.
Recipient must do an FGLSAMP survey on request, to show progression. more...

Fluman Rettig First Generation Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Please ensure to complete the First Generation Grant application in A2O for maximum consideration. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria
1. Applicant must be enrolled at enrolled as a full time undergraduate student and majoring in a major within the Nicholson School of Communication and Media.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

Fluman Rettig First Generation Scholarship
The Fluman Rettig First Generation Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida-Nicholson School of Communication and Media. You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Foreclosure.Com Scholarship
Deadline: Dec. 15, 2022 at 11:59 p.m. ET
*Requirements: *
Here are the text requirements
Minimum 800 words
Maximum 2,000
Must have a title for the essay
Essay must be in English
Awards: Three winners will be selected
Top prize $4,000
Second and third place will receive $1000 each
2022 essay topic:
Foreclosures and other financially distressed home listings such as bankruptcy homes and tax lien properties can be great deals.
Discuss how to prepare and execute these kinds of real estate opportunities considering the high prices and low inventory being seen in the current housing market.
The real estate market has seen some remarkably high prices recently with many people receiving offers 20% or more over their asking price within days of listing a property for sale. Foreclosures, bankruptcy homes, and tax liens properties can offer other paths to getting a great deal. Explain how you can research and capitalize on these financially distressed opportunities.
About the scholarship program:
Foreclosure.com has issued $72,000 in scholarship money to 40 college students nationwide since the program was introduced in 2009.
Each year, the company challenges future leaders of America to provide creative solutions/ideas to many of the nation’s most critical issues, real estate in particular, which can be used to help foster a robust United States housing market.
Foreclosure.com Scholarship Program at a Glance
Foreclosure.com continues to break new ground by offering a nationwide scholarship program. Currently enrolled college students (graduate students, law students and/or high school seniors are NOT eligible) are invited to apply by submitting an essay. Freshman entering Fall 2022 are eligible once they have received a student ID number. Plagiarism is strictly forbidden. Essays that are not the original work of the entrant will be immediately discarded and eliminated from consideration. more...

Golden Scholars Bridge Program
Application only open to current high school seniors
The Golden Scholars bridge program is an admissions pathway program for under-represented students. Priority is given to first-generation students and City of Miami high school seniors, however all high school seniors are welcome to apply. Students selected to be Golden Scholars will participate in an intensive six-week residential summer bridge program that offers academic preparation, individualized advising, and personal attention from faculty and staff. Upon successful completion of the bridge program, students will participate in the program for all semesters they are enrolled at FIU.
GOLDEN SCHOLARS REQUIREMENTS
To qualify as a candidate for the Golden Scholars bridge program, applicants must be:
Under-represented college students (priority given to Pell Grant eligible first-generation college students)
Florida residents (per state residency guidelines)
Pell Grant eligible as determined by the federal FAFSA application
Have a minimum 3.0 high school GPA
Have a minimum 18 ACT composite score or 900 SAT composite score
To apply to the Golden Scholars bridge program, students must:
Submit a complete FIU Undergraduate Admission application and the Golden Scholars bridge program application.
Answer the nine yes/no questions on the Golden Scholars bridge program application on AcademicWorks
Submit ACT and SAT scores to the Office of Undergraduate Admission.
NOTE: Please submit a minimum of 18 ACT composite score or 900 SAT composite score. Satisfying these minimum requirements does not guarantee admission into the program.
Complete both the 2022-23 and 2023-24 FAFSA.
NOTE: Students are encouraged to use the IRS Data Retrieval Tool on the FAFSA website.
Complete the Florida Residency Affidavit Form with required documentation. Please be prepared to upload residency documents for your parent/guardian when submitting your online admissions application.
For more information, contact scholarships@fiu.edu or (305) 348 -0349.
For further assistance and eligibility questions, email gsbp@fiu.edu. more...

Goodwin Endowed Scholarship Fund
Established in 2008 by Nina and Paul Goodwin, this gift provides funding for The Jacksonville Commitment scholarship program. Paul Goodwin, a retired CSX executive, has had a longtime affiliation with the University as a donor and Foundation Board member. more...

Goodwin First Generation Endowed Scholarship
Established in 2008 by Nina and Paul Goodwin, this gift provides funding for first generation college students. Paul Goodwin, a retired CSX executive, has had a longtime affiliation with the University as a donor and Foundation Board member. more...

Goostree Law Group Bright Futures Scholarship
The Goostree Law Group gladly offers financial assistance to college and university students twice a year through our Bright Futures Scholarship. This award opportunity is provided to students with demonstrated financial need who exhibit leadership, determination, and passion in their academic studies and personal lives.
The Goostree Law Group Bright Futures Scholarship provides one student each semester with the opportunity to receive $2,500. The award may be used toward the student’s educational expenses, including tuition and books.
Student Eligibility
Before applying for our scholarship, please consider the following eligibility criteria required to receive our award:
1. You have a need for financial assistance, with an annual household income of less than $75,000.
2. You achieved a 3.0 GPA or higher in your most recently completed academic semester.
3. You are a citizen or permanent resident of the United States.
4. You are enrolled at an accredited college or university for the upcoming semester.
Application Instructions
Your application must include a one-page, high-quality essay, answering the following prompt in 500-1000 words:
Tell us about yourself. Please describe how you have demonstrated these three characteristics throughout your academic or personal life:
Leadership
Determination
Passion
We also ask each applicant to submit the following information to be considered for our scholarship: statement of financial need, proof of enrollment in a U.S. college or university, contact information, and a professional headshot of applicant.
Winner Selection
Each application will be reviewed and evaluated based on these factors:
1. You meet all eligibility requirements.
2. Your essay is thoughtful and answers the prompt completely.
3. Your writing is organized, professional, and original.
After the deadline, all applications will be reviewed by our scholarship team. Once we have chosen a winner, our team will email the recipient individually no later than October 27, 2022.
Contacting the Scholarship Team
All questions and concerns regarding our scholarship program should be directed to our scholarship email address at scholarship@familydivorcelaw.com. Please refrain from calling the firm’s office number or using our contact form, as your questions may not be answered. more...

Gpstab Scholarship
GPSTab is a comprehensive telematics suite that helps trucking businesses drive more miles and make more money. Created by truckers for truckers, our trucker-friendly ELD, trackers, and cameras make it easy to boost profits every week by legally maximizing driving hours and keeping fleets safe on the road.
Anyone attending a U.S. accredited university or trade school can apply for one of (2) $2,500 scholarships. GPSTab values the continued growth and perseverance of our communities—which is why we believe that education is a key component in assuring their success.
Because students will play a key part in moving our communities forward, we want to help them on their path to higher education, so they can one day provide the world with next-generation solutions.
Eligibility Requirements
The GPSTab scholarship is open to trade school, undergraduate and graduate students from any university in the U.S. in any field.
How to Apply
To apply for our scholarship, applicants must submit the following in an email to scholarship@gpstab.com.
Your first and last name
Your personal bio (300 words or less)
Your major
Name of School
Intended Graduation Date
Email address
A 500-word essay or a short 1-minute video about how you see technology influencing your field of study in the future.
Submission Deadline
September 1
Selection Process
The two winning applicants will be notified by March 1st. You’ll receive an email from scholarship@gpstab.com, with information on how to proceed. Good luck!
Additional Information
These scholarships are a one time award per person, and can be used for any academic expenses, including housing costs, food, books, tuition and transportation to and from school.
Do you have questions?
For any additional questions, please contact scholarship@gpstab.com more...

Health Professions Scholarship Program (Hpsp)
Health Professions Scholarship Program (HPSP)
3 year and 4-year medical school scholarship INCENTIVES:
100% tuition paid to accredited M.D. or D.O. school
Monthly stipend of about $2,500.00 less taxes for 10 ½months (Cost of living adjustment every July)
Optional $20,000.00 Accession Bonus
Reimbursed for required books, academic fees, and equipment
2LT (O-1) for the duration ofM.D./D.O. school

CPT (O-3) after successful completion of school and complex/USMLE

Basic Eligibility:

A baccalaureate degree from an accredited school
Minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
Minimum MCAT score of 500, with at least 124 in each line score
Applying for careers or scholarships with America’s #1 Army Medical Recruiting Company ensures that you will receive top-tier care and attention, with maximum effort from our team to improve your chances of selection!
Contact any of our teams to learn more about any of the following US Army career and scholarship options:
Health Professions Scholarship Program
Every year, applicants from around the country compete for the Health Professions Scholarship Program which offers a full-ride scholarship and a monthly stipend, For medical school scholarship recipients, it also offers full salary and benefits during residency and over 90% match rate.
Here are the scholarship programs available to apply for:
4 year Medical/Osteopathy school scholarship for those applying for medical school
3 year Medical/Osteopathy school scholarship for those in their first year
4 year Dental Scholl Scholarship those applying for dental
3 year Veterinary School Scholarship for those in their first year
Nursing Scholarship
Clinical Psychology: 1 and 2 year scholarships
Optometry: 1, 2, and 3 year scholarships
Physicians:
60C Preventive Medicine
60N Anesthesia
60W Psychiatrist
61F Internal Medicine
61H Family Medicine
61J General Surgeon
61K Thoracic Surgeon
61M Orthopedic Surgeon
62A Emergency Medicine
Residency Financial Assistance Program:
If you are working to complete an accredited residency in any of the above-listed programs, you may be eligible to receive an annual grant of more than $45,000 plus a monthly stipend of more than $2,000.
Dental:
63A General Dentist
63F Prosthodontics
63N Oral Maxillofacial Surgeon
Veterinary:
64A General Veterinarian
64B Veterinary Preventive Medicine Officer
Medical Specialists:
65A Occupational Therapist
65A Occupational Therapist Students
65B Physical Therapist
65B Physical Therapy Students (PT Baylor Program)
65C Dietitian
65C Dietetic Students (GPN Program)
65D Physician Assistant
Nursing:

66P Family Nurse Practitioner
66R Psych Nurse Practitioner
66S Critical Care Nurse
66S Critical Care Nurse Student Program

66W Mid-Wife
Medical Service:

71A Microbio/Parasito/Immunologist (PhD)

Helios Education Fdn First Generation Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria
1. Applicants must be enrolled in the College of Community Innovation and Education.
Preference will be given to students seeking a degree in education with the intent to become a teacher in the state of Florida.
2. Applicant must be enrolled at least half-time (6 credits) as an undergraduate student at UCF.
3. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

Helios Education Fdn First Generation Scholarship
The Helios Education FDN First Generation Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a resident of Florida and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Hicks Honors College Fellows Awards
This gift supports Hicks Honor College students as well as Honors in the Major if a junior or senior who are selected as Hicks Fellows and who will work closely with an assigned faculty mentor. Selected Honors College students will choose to work with a faculty mentor, will be given an expense budget each year which can be used as payment for unique student experiences such as but not limited to research assistance duties, travel to conferences, or participating in career-focused internships, etc. Awards are dependent on submitted projects and approved by the Fund Manager. Amounts will typically be $1,000 per year and completed prior to graduation. A minimum 3.20 GPA is required. more...

Hicks Honors College Study Abroad
This gift supports the Hicks Honors College students participate in study abroad experiences.
Must be enrolled in the Hicks Honors College. Must have an approved study abroad trip scheduled to be completed prior to graduation.
Must have a minimum 3.20 UNF GPA.
No student will be eligible to receive more than two study abroad awards. The amount cannot exceed the maximum cost of tuition, books, housing, meal plan, transportation, and miscellaneous expenses, as reflected in the “Cost of Education” budget prepared by the Financial Aid Office. The amount of the award will be determined by the Fund Manager. Currently: between 1,000 – 5,000 depending upon study abroad experience and the length of Study Abroad. Up to 2 weeks up to $1,000, between 2 – 4 weeks up to $1,500, over 4 weeks but less than a semester up to $2,000, one semester up to $3,000, two semesters up to $5,000. more...

Hoggatt Injury Law Scholarship
ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS FOR SPRING 2023
At Hoggatt Injury Law, we are passionate about supporting workers and their families whose lives have been affected by work-related injuries. We know that workplace injuries can have far-reaching financial ramifications, including when it comes to a family’s ability to provide for their children’s educational expenses.
We hope to help families address this challenge by offering a scholarship to the child of an employee who has been injured or killed in a work-related accident. The Hoggatt Injury Law Children of Injured Workers Scholarship provides $1,000 to assist with a student’s tuition and other educational expenses at their chosen college or university anywhere in the United States.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS
You are eligible to apply for the Spring 2023 Hoggatt Injury Law Children of Injured Workers Scholarship if:
Your parent has been affected by a work-related injury
You are enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited U.S. college or university through at least the Spring 2023 semester
You are a U.S. citizen
You are at least 18 years of age
You have a current cumulative GPA of at least 2.5
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS
You are eligible to apply for the Spring 2022 Hoggatt Injury Law Children of Injured Workers Scholarship if:
Your parent has been affected by a work-related injury
You are enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited U.S. college or university through at least the Spring 2022 semester
You are a U.S. citizen
You are at least 18 years of age
You have a current cumulative GPA of at least 2.5
HOW TO APPLY
Your application must include an essay of between 500 and 1,000 words in response to the prompt:
What are your academic and career goals, and how will this scholarship help you achieve them? In what ways have your parents inspired you to further your education?
Additionally, you will need to include a description and documentation of your parent’s work injury. Acceptable documentation could include a medical report showing work restrictions or an impairment rating, a signed letter by the treating physician, or a disability benefits award letter from a state workers’ compensation division, the Social Security Administration, or the Department of Veterans Affairs.
We also require that you submit a current academic transcript showing your cumulative GPA, along with contact information including your address, phone number, and email address, and a professional photograph of yourself (.jpg file).
ALL MATERIALS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY THE DEADLINE OF JANUARY 5, 2023 11:59 PM MOUNTAIN TIME.
SELECTING A WINNER
The attorneys and staff at Hoggatt Injury Law will evaluate applications based on these criteria:
Thoughtful self-reflection and original ideas
Quality of writing, including grammar, organization, and clarity
Financial need and adherence to other application requirements
The Spring 2023 recipient will be selected and notified by February 6, 2023, and the award will be submitted through the financial aid office at the winner’s school. Scholarship recipients must consent to their name, likeness, and essay being featured on our website, social media channels, and other marketing materials. more...

Homelight Scholarship
Scholarship Details:
We want to support like-minded students who share our passion for improving the world of real estate.
That’s why we’re offering a $1,000 scholarship to talented students who hold an interest in homes and homeownership.
If you’re interested in designing homes, building homes, placing people in homes, combatting homelessness, or studying the housing market, we want to help fund your education.
Eligibility:
Any legal U.S. resident in high school or college who will be attending an accredited university or college in Fall 2022 is eligible to apply.
Eligible Areas of Study:
Design Homes:
Interior Design
Architecture
Build Homes:
Construction
Urban Planning
Place People in Homes:
Real Estate
Business
Social Work
Criminal Justice
Psychology
Housing & Economic Studies:

Economics
Sociology
How to Apply:
To apply, please submit a short piece of writing, that includes the following:
Why are you interested in real estate?
How will your career help more people find their dream home?
What impact have you had on homes or homelessness in your community?
Recipients will be selected based on the overall strength of their application materials.
Deadlines
Deadline to apply for Spring Semester 2023: December 1, 2022 more...

Hospitality Graduate Scholarship
Scholarships are available to admitted graduate Hospitality Management Students in the Chaplin School of Hospitality and Tourism Management, BEGINNING IN SPRING 2023 ONLY. If you were admitted or started in a previous semester, you are not eligible. If you are starting in a future semester, please wait until the scholarship application for your start date opens.
Criteria:
Must be a Florida Resident (for tuition purposes)
Must be fully admitted student to Spring 2023 Master of Science in Hospitality Management, including:
- Revenue Management Specialization
- Hospitality Real Estate Development Specialization
- Mega and Large Scale Events Specialization
Must be enrolled full-time (minimum 9 graduate credits during the term of award in both Spring 2023 & Fall 2023)
Minimum 3.25 GPA as calculated by the Graduate Admissions Office (3.25 GPA in upper-division 60 credits)
To apply, students should submit a scholarship application including:
- Applicants must write a 1 – 2 page statement of professional goals, including reasons how receiving a scholarship is going to help them achieve their educational goals.
- Current resume
Award
$3,000.00 ($1,500 each in Spring 2023 and renewable for $1,500 in Fall 2023 with 3.0 GPA) more...

Hospitality Graduate Scholarship - Non-Florida Residents
Scholarships are available to admitted graduate Hospitality Management Students in the Chaplin School of Hospitality and Tourism Management, BEGINNING IN SPRING 2023 ONLY. If you were admitted or started in a previous semester, you are not eligible. If you are starting in a future semester, please wait until the scholarship application for your start date opens.
Criteria:
Must be a Non-Florida Resident (for tuition purposes)
Must be fully admitted student to Spring 2023 Master of Science in Hospitality Management, including:
- Revenue Management Specialization
- Hospitality Real Estate Development Specialization
- Mega and Large Scale Events Specialization
Must be enrolled full-time (minimum 9 graduate credits during the term of award in both Spring 2023 – Fall 2023)
Minimum 3.25 GPA as calculated by the Graduate Admissions Office (3.25 GPA in upper-division 60 credits)
To apply, students should submit a scholarship application including:
- Applicants must write a 1 – 2 page statement of professional goals, including reasons how receiving a scholarship is going to help them achieve their educational goals.
- Current resume
Award
$5,000.00 ($2,500 each in Spring 2023 and renewable for $2,500 in Fall 2023 with 3.0 GPA) more...

Hospitality Transfer Scholarship: Florida State College Transfers
THIS SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION IS FOR NEW UNDERGRADUATE, HOSPITALITY TRANSFER STUDENTS ENTERING IN SPRING 2023 ONLY. If you were admitted or started in a previous semester, you are not eligible. If you are starting in a future semester, please wait until the scholarship application for your start date opens.
Transfer scholarship opportunity for graduates of one of the 26 Florida State Colleges (formerly community colleges).
This limited, competitive scholarship awards $1,000 ($500 each semester for up to 2 semesters) for transfer students with A.S./A.A. degree or at least 60 transferable credits from one of the public Florida State Colleges. WE ANTICIPATE 2 AWARDS FOR SPRING 2023.
Student Eligibility requirements:
• Student must have been accepted to FIU in the Hospitality Management program, including
o Beverage Management
o Entertainment Management
o Event Management
o Global Sustainable Tourism
o Hospitality Management (no specific major)
o Hotel/Lodging Management
o Restaurant/Culinary Management
o Spirits Management
o Travel & Tourism Management
• Student must have at least 2.75 GPA (as calculated by Admissions) and be a first-time transfer student to FIU with at least 60 transferable credits
• Student must enter FIU for their original entry date (i.e. award cannot be deferred to a future semester) and must be registered full-time (at least 12 credit hours in each of their first two semesters)
To apply, students should submit a scholarship application including:
• Student must write a 1 – 2 page essay discussing “Why you have chosen Hospitality and Tourism as a Career”
• Resume, including (1) work experience/industry experience, (2) previous awards/honors, and (3) service to your college and/or community
For questions about this scholarship opportunity, please contact Dawn Fagnan, Asst. Director of Enrollment and Recruitment Services, at (305) 919-4513 or fagnand@fiu.edu. more...

Hospitality Transfer Scholarship: Non-Florida Transfer Student
THIS SCHOLARSHIP IS FOR NON-FLORIDA RESIDENTS ADMITTED AS TRANSFER STUDENTS TO THE UNDERGRADUATE HOSPITALITY PROGRAM BEGINNING IN SPRING 2023. If you were admitted or started in a previous semester, you are not eligible. If you are starting in a future semester, please wait until the scholarship application for your start date opens.
This limited, competitive scholarship awards $6,000 ($3,000 each semester in Spring 2023 and Fall 2023) for non-Florida resident transfer students with A.S./A.A. degree or at least 60 transferable credits. THERE IS ONLY ONE AWARD AVAILABLE.
Student Eligibility requirements:
• Student must have been accepted to FIU in the Hospitality Management program, including
o Beverage Management
o Entertainment Management
o Event Management
o Global Sustainable Tourism
o Hospitality Management (no specific major)
o Hotel/Lodging Management
o Restaurant/Culinary Management
o Spirits Management
o Travel & Tourism Management
• Student must have at least 2.75 GPA (as calculated by Admissions) and be a first-time transfer student to FIU with at least 60 transferable credits
• Student must be classified as out-of-state for tuition and residency purposes (international students are eligible)
• Student must enter FIU for their original entry date (i.e. award cannot be deferred to a future semester) and must be registered full-time (at least 12 credit hours in each of their first two semesters)
To apply, students should submit a scholarship application including:
• Student must write a 1 – 2 page essay discussing “Why you have chosen Hospitality and Tourism as a Career”
• Resume, including (1) work experience/industry experience, (2) previous awards/honors, and (3) service to your college and/or community
For questions about this scholarship opportunity, please contact Dawn Fagnan, Asst. Director of Enrollment and Recruitment Services, at (305) 919-4513 or fagnand@fiu.edu. more...

Hospitality Transfer Scholarships: Broward College - Vietnam Spring 2023 Transfers
THIS SCHOLARSHIP IS FOR BROWARD COLLEGE – VIETNAM TRANSFER STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE UNDERGRADUATE HOSPITALITY PROGRAM BEGINNING IN SPRING 2023. If you were admitted or started in a previous semester, you are not eligible. If you are starting in a future Spring semester, please wait until the scholarship application for your start date opens. This award is expected to be offered each Spring semester. Students from any Broward College International Center starting in Summer or Fall should apply for the “Broward College International Centers Out-of-State Tuition Fee Waiver Application” through AcademicWorks at https://fiu.academicworks.com.
This limited, competitive scholarship awards up to $5,000 per student over a period of two years/four semesters of enrollment. The award will be disbursed each Spring and Fall semester in $1,250 increments for Broward College-Vietnam transfer students (i.e. non-Florida resident) with A.S./A.A. degree or at least 60 transferable credits. An overall 3.0 GPA is required to renew the award in future Fall/Spring semesters. THERE ARE FOUR (4) AWARDS AVAILABLE.
Student Eligibility requirements:
• Student must have been accepted to FIU as a Hospitality Management program, including
o Beverage Management
o Event Management
o Entertainment Management
o Global Sustainable Tourism (Bachelor of Arts degree, online only)
o Hospitality Management (no specific major)
o Hotel/Lodging Management
o Restaurant/Culinary Management
o Spirits Management
o Travel & Tourism Management
• Student must have at least 2.75 GPA (as calculated by Admissions) and be a first-time transfer student to FIU with at least 60 transferable credits
• Student must be classified as out-of-state for tuition and residency purposes (international students are eligible)
• Student must enter FIU for their original entry date in Spring 2023 (i.e. award cannot be transferred for entry in a future semester) and must be registered full-time (at least 12 credit hours in each semester)
• Student must maintain a 3.0 GPA at FIU for the award to be renewed for an additional three (3) semesters; this award is not available in Summer semesters
To apply, students should submit a scholarship application including:
• Student must write a 1 – 2 page essay discussing “Why you have chosen Hospitality and Tourism as a Career”
• Resume, including (1) work experience/industry experience, (2) previous awards/honors, and (3) service to your college and/or community
For questions about this scholarship opportunity, please contact Dawn Fagnan, Assoc. Director of Enrollment and Recruitment Services, at (305) 919-4513 or fagnand@fiu.edu. more...

I. Adopt-A-Student Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Florida College in Temple Terrace, Florida. Applicants must submit a FAFSA application and fall within the required guidelines for Expected Family Contributions (EFC). These awards help students who fall short of aid through normal channels. Candidates must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and take out a student loan. Qualifying students are paired with donors who adopt a part of their college cost for the year. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Ida F. Chadwick
Award for 2022-2023
Dr. Ida F. Chadwick is being remembered for her dedication to the field of Physical Education through this special endowment for Elementary Physical Education majors.  Dr. Chadwick committed her professional career to the advancement and advocacy of Physical Education for America’s children and youth.  Dr. Chadwick’s years of service, contributions to the field, and standards for professional preparation are recognized through this award.
Minimum eligibility requirements:
Must be enrolled as a full-time, degree-seeking senior (9 credits) admitted in the K-8 Physical Education program; Cumulative GPA 3.25 or above; Demonstrated commitment to the profession and the College through acts of service; Submission of a typed personal statement (double spaced, two-page maximum) that describes your educational goals and tells how being a recipient of this scholarship will help you fulfill them; Submission of one (1) letter of recommendation from a teacher/professor/other professional who can attest to your academic potential, leadership qualities and/or community service.
Recipients MUST be enrolled for the Fall 2022 & Spring 2023 more...

Ida F. Chadwick Memorial Scholarship Endowment

Students must have a minimum 3.25 GPA and demonstrate commitment through service. Due date and number of awards may vary. A personal statement must be included with application packet. more...

Il Circolo Scholarships For Excellence In Italian Studies

Infotracer Scholarship
About Us
InfoTracer.com is a premier boutique information agency that aggregates public records into a massive repository. Our proprietary database houses billions of records that our users search every day to find information on individuals in the U.S. Our system allows us to provide the most comprehensive reports anywhere. Our customers enjoy searching through arrest records, court records, vital information (birth, death, marriage, and divorce), license plate information, email address, and phone lookups, social media and much more, all from the privacy of their own homes. Our customer support team is second to none! We take great pride in servicing our accounts and offering our consumers the most value at the best price when searching for information on individuals in the U.S.
InfoTracer is offering a $1,000 scholarship to one lucky individual. The prize is payable in U.S. funds and will be awarded at the end of the contest.
Eligibility
InfoTracer offers a great service to consumers, but we also care about community involvement. We are offering eligible students the opportunity to win $1,000 in scholarship money for college for the 2022-2023 school year.
To qualify for this educational grant, you must be a high school graduate pursuing a full-time college or university placement or already enrolled in college full time.
Additionally, you must be enrolled in an accredited college, university or vocational/trade school that is approved by the U.S. Department of Education and allowed to participate in financial aid programs.
You must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher.
Grants are not renewable; you must apply each year and start fresh with a new application.
To be eligible in future years, you must demonstrate your academic progress through advancement. If you do not meet these specific requirements, you will need to provide college transcripts (unofficial) and a statement of explanation as to any limitations or reasons.
Students enrolled in distance, or online education courses will need to check with their school officials to verify that their enrollment meets the school’s full-time status.
Application Procedure
Please follow the application procedure below to enter
to win the $1,000 scholarship from InfoTracer.com.
Download a copy of the application here: DOWNLOAD

Include a copy of the front and back of your military or student ID.
Include your most recent cumulative transcript (unofficial) showing grades through June, 2022 on a 4.0 GPA rating scale.
You will also need to write a 1000-word essay. Your article should be interesting, engaging and informative to the reader.
There is no age requirement to apply for this grant.
This program is open to all legal residents and citizens of the United States and all its territories.
Employees of InfoTracer.com, are not eligible to apply.
Void where prohibited by law.
You must submit your completed application package by December 31, 2022, to scholarships@InfoTracer.com.
Application Essay Requirement
If you choose to apply for an InfoTracer.com education grant, you will be required, as part of the application process, to submit an original essay about how public records are useful in your chosen career (“Your Essay”). You retain ownership of the copyright in Your Essay. By submitting Your Essay, however, you grant us a royalty-free license to copy, distribute, publicly display, and make derivatives of Your Essay, and to otherwise use Your Essay on and in the promotion of the InfoTracer.com website. more...

International Council Of Shopping Centers "Icsc" First Generation Scholarship
Established by International Council of Shopping Centers “ICSC” this scholarship support students interested in Real Estate who are the first generation in their family to attend college.
Eligibility Requirements
First generation in family to attain a college degree (neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher; students whose siblings have attained or are pursuing a degree are eligible). FASFA must indicate that neither parent’s education level is above high school.
Qualify as a Florida resident for tuition purposes.
Enrolled for a minimum of 6 credit hours per term as a degree-seeking undergraduate student. Some First Gen Scholarships will require full-time enrollment.
Demonstrate financial need by completing the national Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and be eligible for a Pell Grant.
Maintain a minimum 2.0 cumulative GPA. Some First-Generation Awards will require a higher GPA.
Real Estate Major or Business Major with an interest in real estate
Preference for renewals
Preference for Freshman
Expectations:
Recipients will be expected to participate in the ICSC Mentorship program and workshops hosted by FIU and ICSC. Participation will impact future renewal.
Questions? Contact the Office of Scholarships at scholarships@fiu.edu or 305-348-0349. more...
