James Van Vleck Promising Futures Endowed Scholarship
Established in 2005 by Jim Van Vleck, this gift provides scholarships for students majoring in art history, ceramics and sculpture, graphic design, multimedia, painting, drawing or photography in the College of Arts and Sciences. Eligible students must present at a regional or national conference or have a UNF-approved study abroad trip scheduled to be completed prior to graduation. more...

James W. Button Memorial Award
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Liberal Arts and Sciences Department of Political Science. Students must demonstrate commitment to urban governance and racial-ethnic politics, gay and lesbian politics, the politics of poverty, social inequality, gender, age, and/or related issues. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

James W. Locke Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Law. Students must demonstrate academic achievement and financial need. Preference given to male students. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

James W. Van Horn Music Fund Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Fine Arts School of Music. Students must have financial need and demonstrate proficiency in chorale singing, composing and/or conducting, and performance. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Jan & Frank Graham Memorial Scholarship
Employee-Related awards for Certified Nursing Assistants (present/prior) who are undergraduate students attending St. Petersburg College and are majoring in Nursing. Selection based on academic achievement. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. more...

Jan L. Tucker Memorial Scholarship Endowment
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Florida International University College of Education majoring in Social Studies Education. Students must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and a commitment to global awareness. Due date and number of awards may vary. An personal statement must be included with application packet. more...

Jan L.Tucker Scholarship
Award for 2022-2023
Professor Jan L. Tucker was among the first global educators in the United States to bring public awareness to the importance of integrating a global awareness into curriculum and instruction in public schools and universities on the national and international levels in order to prepare the youth of nations for a rapidly changing increasingly interdependent world. On the local level, Dr. Tucker was instrumental in implementing global education programs in Miami’s public schools and in the social studies teacher education program at Florida International University. In memory of her late husband, Dr. Toni Fuss Kirkwood-Tucker and friends have created a permanent endowment to provide annual scholarships to students in education who will teach from a global perspective in their profession.
Minimum eligibility requirements:
Applicants must be enrolled as a full-time, degree-seeking undergraduate or graduate student in the School of Education and Human Development majoring in Curriculum and Instruction in the Social Studies with an emphasis on Global Awareness, or majoring in International/Intercultural Education; posess a GPA of 3.0 or above; must submit an essay on why global education is a necessity in education in the 21st century and one (1) letter of recommendation from a teacher/professor/other professional who can attest to your academic potential, leadership qualities and/or community service. The scholarship is based on both merit and need.
Recipients MUST be enrolled for the Fall 2022 & Spring 2023 semester. more...

Jane Adams Edmonds Ph.D. Fellowship Fund
Scholarship for doctoral students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Health and Human Performance. Students must be U.S. citizens. Preference given to Exercise and Sport Sciences majors. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Jane Addams Fund
Recipient must be a student in the College of Social Work with financial need. more...

Jane Austen Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Schiller International University. Selection is based on academic achievement, financial need, and nationality. Students must be British citizens. Due date and award amount may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Jane D. Cope Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Florida International University. Applicants who are undergraduates must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and graduates must have a minimum 3.3 GPA. Students who are recent immigrants, migrants, Miccosukee and Seminole Indians are eligible. Preference given to students ineligible due to citizenship status. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Jane E. Fisher Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for college juniors or seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Journalism and Communications majoring in Telecommunications. Students must be working at WUFT-FM. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Jane O. Mcquire Memorial Scholarship Endowment
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Florida International University College of Education majoring in Special Education. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need, and demonstrate a desire to impact children in underserved communities. Due date and number of awards may vary. A personal statement must be included with application packet. more...

Jane O. Mcquire Scholarship
Award for 2022-2023
Ms. Carrie Otto created this scholarship in honor of her mother, Jane O’ McQuire, a Miami-Dade County Public School teacher for over 17 years.  Jane’s lifelong dedication to enhancing opportunities for underprivileged areas inspired the “magnet” gifted program at Naranja Elementary School in Homestead.  This scholarship is for students with an interest in special education and/or gifted students.
Minimum Eligibility Requirements:
Must be enrolled as a full-time, degree-seeking student (12 credits undergraduate / 9 credits graduate) in Education; Special Education/Gifted major; GPA 3.0 or above; U.S. citizens or permanent resident; Demonstrated financial need based on federal financial aid standards as determined by the University’s Financial Aid Office; Personal statement (500-1,000 words) regarding personal career goals as they relate to Special Education and the Urban environment. more...

Jane Thompson Award
Annual Internship for graduate students enrolled full-time at Florida Atlantic University College of Architecture, Urban and Public Affairs. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Jane Thompson Award
The Jane Thompson Award is available to graduate students enrolled in the School of Architecture at Florida Atlantic University. This award includes a one-year internship. more...

Janet Chusmir Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Florida International University majoring in Journalism (print). Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Janice A. And Robert C. Machin Study Abroad Scholarship
Established in 2011, this gift provides scholarships for students majoring in art history, allowing them to participate in a UNF-approved study abroad program. Janice Machin taught part time as a faculty member in UNF’s Department of Art and Design. more...

Janice A. Wood And Lowell D. Wood Endowed Scholarship
This fund was established 2018 by Janice A. and Lowell D. Wood to provide scholarship funding for College of Education and Human Services students. Juniors or seniors majoring in Early Childhood Education, PreK/Primary Education or Elementary Education are eligible and preference will be given to those concentrating in reading or literacy. more...

Janine Ella Ackerman Scholarship
This scholarship honors the memory of Janine Ella Ackerman, alumna of the Chaplin School of Hospitality and Tourism Management. Janine received her Master’s degree in 2008 from FIU and was also the President of the Eta Sigma Delta International Hospitality Management Honor Society. She was also selected as a student leader at the Food Network & Cooking Channel South Beach Wine and Food Festival and was a stellar student who was loved by many students, staff and faculty. She was a vibrant, intelligent, determined young woman with an enthusiastic personality. As a professional, she was a hard worker, leader, mentor and role model for others.
This scholarship is open to graduate students of the Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management. Awarded during the 2022 academic year.
Eligibility Criteria:
Must be enrolled or accepted for admission to the University
Must be a graduate degree-seeking student in the School of Hospitality
Must have a minimum GPA of 3.27 if entering the graduate program OR must have a minimum GPA of 3.33 if currently enrolled in the graduate program
Must work within the hospitality industry with documentation of a minimum of 30 hours/week
Must have extracurricular hospitality activity (i.e. South Beach Wine & Food Festival, certifications, volunteer work, etc.)
Applicants will be required to submit an essay of no less than 1500 words on “Leadership and what it means to do the right thing.” Essays of the finalists will be shared with the Donor.
Student must visit the Writing Center to have them review your essay. Submit letter/confirmation from the Writing Center that you met with them.
Students must be a citizen of the United States, a U.S. lawful permanent resident or an international student on an aid eligible visa.
If selected as a recipient for this scholarship, please note the following:
Prior to disbursing your award, it is imperative that a “thank you” letter, a brief biography and an appropriate head shot be submitted via AcademicWorks.*
Questions- contact the Office of Scholarships at scholarships@fiu.edu. more...

John A. Centrone Memorial Endowed Scholarship Fund
Recipient must be an undergraduate or graduate student attending Florida State University Panama City. Primary recipients of the scholarship will be graduates of the Panama City Marine Institute (PCMI). If there are no PCMI graduates, a scholarship of up to $1,200 per academic year, which shall be prorated based upon semester hour enrollment, may be awarded to a qualified student. The scholarship will be awarded for one full academic year and may be applied to any degree program available at the FSU Panama City Campus. Scholarships may be awarded to qualified students who exhibit financial need. A minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.5 is required to receive the scholarship award. The recipient must maintain a 2.5 to 2.8 GPA during the award period. The recipient must be enrolled for a minimum of six (6) semester hours each semester. more...

John F. Stack, Jr. First Generation Scholarship
Established in honor of the Founding Dean of the Steven J. Green School of International & Public Affairs, John F. Stack, Jr, this scholarship support first generation students enrolled in the Green School at FIU.
Eligibility Requirements
i. Recipients must be the first generation in their family to attain a college degree (students whose siblings have attained or are pursuing a degree are eligible).
ii. Recipients must be residents of the state of Florida.
iii. Recipients must be degree-seeking undergraduate students enrolled for a minimum of six credit hours per semester.
iv. Recipients must demonstrate financial need by completing the national Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and be eligible for a Pell Grant.
Additional Criteria
v. Recipients must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher.
vi. Recipients must be enrolled in a program under the School of International and Public Affairs.
vii. Essay will be submitted based on the following prompt-Write a 250-word essay on how your degree at FIU will help you advance understanding, prosperity, peace and security in the world.
Questions- Contact the Office of Scholarships at 305-348-0349 or scholarships@fiu.edu more...

John Giorgi Scholarship
The John Giorgi Scholarship is an initiative of John Giorgi, founder of the Law Offices of John Giorgi, P.C, a well-known New Jersey firm involved in Debt Collection, Workers Compensation, Personal Injury, and Litigation. John knows personally of the difficulties of financing higher education, and just how important it is as a path to success. The John Giorgi Scholarship was founded to support bright minds, and help fulfill their career goals and aspirations.
Criteria
Eligible Candidates: Students with excellent academic records currently pursuing their undergraduate studies, enrolled in a full-time graduate program, or involved in postgraduate research programs may apply for this scholarship.
Courses: The financial aid consists of a one-time $1,000 award, and will be given to a student pursuing their full-time academic program at either the undergraduate, graduate, or research-based postgraduate level.
Award Details: The scholarship award will be sent to the university where the winning student attends and deposited directly into his/her financial aid account.
Application Deadline: October 1, 2021

Award Date: The winner of the John Giorgi Scholarship will be announced on October 15, 2021.
Essay: Applicants are required to submit an essay covering the following topic: “What do you plan to achieve in your professional life, and how will your education help you?” Please answer in 700-850 words.
For more information please click the link below:
info@johngiorgischolarship.com more...

John H.G. Hutchinson Highland County Scholarship

Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

John Lewis Legacy Of Courage Scholarship (Chick-Fil-A Peach Bowl)
A scholarship shall be awarded to an undergraduate student enrolled at the University of Central Florida.
A scholarship recipient must have graduated from one of the 1 of the 9 Title 1 schools within the Atlanta Public Schools (APS) system: BEST Academy, Carver H.S., Coretta Scott King Young Women’s Leadership Academy, Douglass H.S., Jackson H.S., Mays H.S., South Atlanta H.S., Therrell H.S., and Washington H.S.
If no students are identified as being a graduate from one of the schools listed above, an applicant from any Title 1 high school in the metro Atlanta area as determined by the Metropolitan Statistical Area definition may be selected.
If no students are identified from the previous preference, then an applicant from Grady H.S. or North Atlanta H.S or any Title 1 high school in the state of Georgia may be selected.
If no students are identified from any of the previous preferences, then applicants from any Title 1 school may be selected.
Final scholarship selections will be based on the donor preferences listed above and academic merit.
*A Title 1 school is a federal designation defined by the number of students from low-income families. You can confirm your high school’s status here: https://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/ more...

Jt Legal Group’s College Scholarship
Mission Statement
The passion and commitment of a student with ambitions and dreams towards the enhancements of society are characteristics that JT Legal Group sincerely acknowledges. Higher education brings opportunities for prosperity and no obstacle should get in the way of that, especially financial ones. JT Legal Group is looking to award a college scholarship opportunity in the amount of $2,500 to a student who presents a clear understanding of benefits an attorney provides.
Prompt
The applicant will be asked to provide an essay explaining why they believe hiring an attorney is beneficial rather than dealing with legal issues on their own.
Submission Type
A 500 – 1000 word essay
Double-spaced, 12-point font, One-inch margins
File named as your first and last name (Example: Jane_Doe)
Submitted as a doc. or .pdf file.
Click Here For The Application
Requirements
Must have a GPA above 3.0.
Must submit a completed form along with the essay
Must follow us on social media to stay updated on the winner
Must email the submission to scholarship@jtlegalgroup.com

Rubric for Judging Scholarship Entries
Judging will be based on the following criteria:
Originality of ideas.
Quality of content submission: Organization, structure, and grammatical integrity.
Adherence to the eligibility criteria and instructions.
Announcements
Important Dates:
Opens: February 1st , 2022
Deadline: December 1st, 2022
Winners Notified: January 3rd, 2023
Disclaimer: All submissions are subject to post and display on our JT Legal Group Marketing platforms, including, our blog, newsletters, and social media accounts. more...

The applicant should embody all of the characteristics of leadership, honor and bravery, which warrant this recognition. more...

Kanoski Bresney Stand Up To Distracted Driving Scholarship
Distracted driving, including texting and other cell phone use, is a serious issue that leads to hundreds of thousands of accidents and injuries in the United States each year. The problem is especially prominent among teen and young adult drivers, and teens are also at a greater risk of being the victim of a distracted driving accident.
At Kanoski Bresney, we want to support students who do their part to fight the problem of distracted driving. Through the Kansoki Bresney Stand Up to Distracted Driving Scholarship program, we are offering five scholarships, in the amount of $1,000 each, to students in the U.S. who are pursuing higher education at the undergraduate or graduate level.
Who is Eligible to Apply?
You are eligible for the Kanoski Bresney Stand Up to Distracted Driving Scholarship if the following are true:
You are currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited U.S. college or university, and your education will continue through at least the Fall 2022 semester.
OR
You are a high school senior who will be starting your college or university education in Spring 2023.
You are a U.S. citizen.
You have a current overall GPA of at least 3.0.
Application Instructions
In order to be considered for the scholarship, you must submit a 1,000-word essay responding to the following prompt:
How has distracted driving affected your life? What ideas do you have to raise awareness of the dangers of distracted driving and prevent this behavior among young drivers?

Your essay should be double-spaced, with 12-point font and one-inch margins, and saved as a .doc, .docx, or .pdf file with a file name that includes your first and last name.


In addition to your essay, you will need to submit a current academic transcript, contact information including your name, phone number, address, and email address, and a professional photograph of yourself. more...

Kassi Blakeley Eudaley Endowed Scholarship Fund
Recipient must be students at Florida State University who are employees and/or dependents of Corams Steak and Egg or Coram and Son Tire and Automotive. The Dependent must be directly related to the employee (spouse, son, daughter, or a legally adopted child). Priority will be given to dependents that can still be claimed as a dependent for IRS purposes. It there is no eligible applicant as outlined above, then the scholarship may be awarded to another applicant at the option and approval of the donor. The scholarships are to be awarded based on demonstrated financial need as a priority but may be awarded for academic achievement as a secondary priority. The scholarship will be awarded for one full academic year. The recipient(s) must maintain a 2.5 grade point average (GPA) and be enrolled for a minimum of six (6) semester hours each semester. more...

Kathleen Watson Memorial Scholarship
Kathleen Watson Memorial Scholarship Fund Awarded for Fall 2022.
The scholarship honors the late Kathleen Watson, a long-time and much-loved Communication Arts professor at FIU.
The scholarship is open to Majors in the Department of Communication (Communication Arts, Public Relations, Advertising, Applied Communications) who have received a grade of at least a B in COM 3110, hold at least a 3.0 overall GPA, and who demonstrate community involvement.
Students must be a citizen of the United States, a U.S. lawful permanent resident or an international student on an aid eligible visa.
Application Process
• Purpose and Criteria: To provide a one-time scholarship to deserving Communication Arts majors spring award) who have received a minimum grade of a B in COM 3110, Business and Professional Communication, have at least a 3.0 overall GPA, and who demonstrate community involvement.
• Award Components: The individuals will be selected by the Chair of the Department of Communication in consultation with the family of Kathleen Watson.
Applicant must submit:
Application Cover Letter should be addressed to the Chair of Communication Arts (Aileen Izquierdo). The letter should contain a brief explanation of career goals and biographical (background) information.
One (1) letter of recommendation from an employer, faculty, or individuals with significant knowledge of applicant’s experience and involvement in community service.
Please upload an essay that describes your career goals, explains why you selected communication arts as your major, describes why business communication is an important course in your academic career, and what you personally have done to make your community a better one. Limit to 300 words.
Applicant will be notified by email within 30 days regarding the status of your application.
If you have any questions about the application, please contact Gabriella Portela at dportela@fiu.edu
For additional information, please contact the Office of Scholarships at scholarships@fiu.edu. more...

Kathleen Watson Memorial Scholarship
Kathleen Watson Memorial Scholarship Fund Awarded for Spring 2023.
The scholarship honors the late Kathleen Watson, a long-time and much-loved Communication Arts professor at FIU.
The scholarship is open to Majors in the Department of Communication (Communication Arts, Public Relations, Advertising, Applied Communications) who have received a grade of at least a B in COM 3110, hold at least a 3.0 overall GPA, and who demonstrate community involvement.
Students must be a citizen of the United States, a U.S. lawful permanent resident or an international student on an aid eligible visa.
Application Process
• Purpose and Criteria: To provide a one-time scholarship to deserving Communication Arts majors spring award) who have received a minimum grade of a B in COM 3110, Business and Professional Communication, have at least a 3.0 overall GPA, and who demonstrate community involvement.
• Award Components: The individuals will be selected by the Chair of the Department of Communication in consultation with the family of Kathleen Watson.
Applicant must submit:
Application Cover Letter should be addressed to the Chair of Communication Arts (Aileen Izquierdo). The letter should contain a brief explanation of career goals and biographical (background) information.
One (1) letter of recommendation from an employer, faculty, or individuals with significant knowledge of applicant’s experience and involvement in community service.
Please upload an essay that describes your career goals, explains why you selected communication arts as your major, describes why business communication is an important course in your academic career, and what you personally have done to make your community a better one. Limit to 300 words.
Applicant will be notified by email within 30 days regarding the status of your application.
If you have any questions about the application, please contact Gabriella Portela at dportela@fiu.edu
For additional information, please contact the Office of Scholarships at scholarships@fiu.edu. more...

Kathryn Lehman Weiner Scholarship
Award for 2022-2023
Friends and family of retired Congressman William Lehman created an endowment in memory of his daughter, Kathryn Lehman-Weiner, a dedicated public school teacher.  Kathryn Lehman Weiner scholars in English Education are selected for their love of language and their interest in advancing both verbal and communication skills among our young people.
Minimum eligibility requirements:
Must be enrolled as a full-time, degree-seeking student (12 credits undergraduate) in Education; English Education Major; GPA 3.0 or above; Required essay (1-2 pages) about career goals and an explanation of why the financial assistance would helpful in assisting the student meet his or her goals.
Recipients MUST be enrolled for the Fall 2022 & Spring 2023 semester. more...

Kevin A. Hill Dissertation Improvement Scholarship
The Kevin A. Hill Dissertation Improvement Scholarship was created to benefit graduate students in the Department of Political Science and International Relations who are enrolled in a course of study with a focus on American Politics. Professor Kevin Hill was a professor of Political Science at FIU for twenty-four years with a passion for American government particularly southern politics and Florida politics. Although Professor Hill began his career as an Africanist, he will be remembered for his unique ability to analyze the complexities of American political behavior which inspired many students throughout his career.
Award Amount $1,000.00 each for two students during Spring 2022
Applicants will submit a proposal (1-2 pages) that details how they intend to use $1,000 to improve the quality of their dissertation.
To be eligible, students must:
Be in good academic standing in the Political Science Ph.D. program (minimum 3.0 GPA)
Have passed a first field American Politics comprehensive exam, and
Have an approved D-2 form on file.
Conditions: Any published works aided by the scholarship should acknowledge the Kevin A. Hill Dissertation Improvement Scholarship.
Reporting: Within 18 months of scholarship receipt (or graduation, if sooner), the student will submit a 1-page report to the Graduate Program Director on how the money was spent to improve their dissertation.
Note on disbursement: A processing fee is charged for scholarship disbursements and the final amount received by the student may be less than $1,000 as a result. more...

Kevin A. Hill Research Travel Scholarship
The Kevin A. Hill Scholarship was created to benefit Graduate students in the Department of Political Science and International Relations who are enrolled in a course of study with a focus on American Politics. Professor Kevin Hill was a professor of Political Science in FIU for twenty four years with a passion for American Government particularly Southern Politics and Florida politics. Although Professor Hill began his career as an Africanist, he will be remembered for his unique ability to analyze the complexities of American political behavior which inspired many students throughout his career.
Seven scholarships will be awarded at $283 each
Applicants will submit a 1-page research travel proposal that details: (1) the research-related nature and purposes of the travel, (2) a brief overview of the research project, and (3) how the travel will help them improve the quality of their research project. Students must apply through AcademicWorks and notify the Graduate Program Director (via email) that an application has been submitted.
To be eligible, students must:
Be in good academic standing in the Political Science Ph.D. program (minimum 3.0 GPA), and
Plan on taking, or have already taken, the first field American Politics comprehensive exam.
Conditions: Any published works aided by the scholarship should acknowledge the Kevin A. Hill Research Travel Scholarship.
Reporting: Within 9 months of scholarship receipt (or graduation, if sooner), the student will submit a 1-page report to the Graduate Program Director on how the money was spent on research travel.
What counts as research travel? Any travel directly related to developing or improving a research project (data collection, interviews, archives, field work, conference presentations, etc.).
Note on disbursement: A processing fee is charged for scholarship disbursements and the final amount received by the student may be less than $283 as a result. more...

Kevin And Jane White Endowed Scholarship For First Generation Students
The Kevin and Jane White Endowed Scholarship for First Generation Students is available to full-time undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida-College of Health Professions and Sciences. You must be a first generation college student to be eligible for this award. Preference will be given to students majoring in Kinesiology B.S. Sport and Athletic Coaching. more...

Kevin And Jane White Endowed Scholarship For First- Generation Students
The purpose of the Fund is to provide scholarship awards to full-time students at the University of Central Florida in the College of Health Professions and Sciences.
Recipients will be selected based on the following established criteria:
Applicant must be a first-generation student and demonstrate financial need based upon guidelines set forth in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Preference will be given to students majoring in Kinesiology B.S. Sport and Athletic Coaching. If no student meets this preference, awarding will be open to all first-generation students in the College of Health Professions and Sciences.
This Scholarship, to the extent funds are available, may be used to pay for tuition, textbooks, fees, and any other items included in the cost of education published annually by the University. more...

Kevin L. Mckeown Memorial Scholarship Fund
Recipient must be an undergraduate student in the College of Arts and Sciences within the Department of Biological Science majoring in biology, biochemistry or an equivalent laboratory science program (e.g. medical technology). Preference will be given to a junior, rising junior or junior college transfer student who is a resident of Pinellas County, FL or the surrounding counties. more...

Kevin Neidorf Student Award
Recipient must be an undergraduate student in the School of Communication. Preference will be given to a student pursing a degree in media production with a 3.0 GPA and who best demonstrates Kevin’s outstanding qualities for connecting his talent for media production with a passion for making a difference in the community.

The Kevin Neidorf Student Award was established by Scott and Paula Neidorf in memory of their son, Kevin Neidorf, who passed away on January 21, 2019 at the young age of 28. This award celebrates his life and legacy.
Kevin graduated in 2013 with a degree in digital media production. He had a passion for people, living, inspiring others to think beyond the limits, and do beyond the limits. He connected his talent in media production with his love for cycling and the outdoors and his creativity shone through with the exemplary work that he did to advocate for the environment and social issues, especially homelessness, among other worthy causes. Through this award, Kevin’s legacy will live on and will make an impact on the lives of students for many years to come.
During his time at Florida State University, Kevin participated in the FSU Cycling Team as Team Captain and produced several well-received videos featuring cycling competitions and various bike-related content. One notable video in particular, The Magic Hour, won the 2014 Pedals 4 Professionals Contest, presented by Reliance Foundry.
Kevin also penned an essay titled Facelessbook which earned him the James M. McCrimmon Award in 2010. It delves into his more creative side and good-natured curiosity for the world around him. “Our McCrimmon awarded essays are selected annually from a pool of teacher-nominated student projects and they serve as exemplars for students in the writing program,” says a representative from FSU’s College Composition Committee. “It is still a strong example of writing and particularly of the analysis genre. The award is a competitive one, so Kevin must have impressed the panel of judges to have won. “We are proud to feature his work as a former winner and mourn with you all in this loss.”

Award recipients are REQUIRED to learn about Kevin’s life and legacy from the links below and acknowledge the family who created the award and include in the thank you letter something they have learned about Kevin’s accomplishments.

Scottish Highland Route
The Magic Hour
Facelessbook
River City Bicycles more...

Kristi Wilder "Are You My Friend?" Endowed Scholarship/Fellowship Fund
Established in 2003, this scholarship/fellowship is awarded to juniors, seniors or graduate students majoring in special education who demonstrate financial need. Students must live in Nassau, Duval, Baker, Clay or St. Johns, Florida counties, with first preference given to those living in Nassau and second preference to Duval residents. The endowment was created in memory of Kristi Wilder, a young woman who survived longer than doctors expected, against all odds with physical and mental disabilities but with a warm and loving heart that knew no boundaries. She would ask everyone she met, “Are you my friend?” more...

Kure’s College Scholarship
Kure’s College Scholarship awards one $1,000 scholarship twice per year to students who improve their community by completing a business-related process optimization project in Kure.
Applications (completed projects) are accepted from February 1, 2022, to May 1, 2022

Deadline to submit your application is May 1, 2022
Winner will be notified by email and announced on KureKo.com on May 20, 2022
All eligible projects will be published on our website, so even if you don’t win, you’ll be able to showcase your work and link it to your resume, social media profiles, etc.
Here are some project examples: https://kureko.com/projects.
How To Apply
Sign up for Kure for free: https://app.kureko.com/register
Complete a Quick Win Project in Kure (get AI + live project support via chat)
Notify us that your project is complete via chat (bottom right chat icon) more...

L.A. Lee Family First Generation Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
The purpose of the scholarship is to provide awards to first generation undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida in the College of Community Innovation and Education.
Recipients will be selected based on the following established criteria:
1. The applicant must be a first generation college student.
2. The applicant must be a Florida resident.
3. Have attempted less 132 total credit hours
4. The applicant must be Pell eligible
5. The applicant must demonstrate financial need based upon guidelines set forth in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
-First preference will be given to Elementary Education Majors. If a student cannot be identified who meets the first preference, second preference will be given to Early Childhood Development and Education Majors.
-If a student cannot be identified who meets one of the first two preferences, third preference will be given to a student in the College of Community Innovation and Education. more...

Larson M. And Beverly J. Bland Endowed Scholarship
Recipient must be an undergraduate student at Florida State University Panama City in first priority or for graduate students attending Florida State University Panama City. The scholarship(s) will be awarded for one full academic year and may be applied to any degree program available to Florida State University Panama City. Scholarships will be awarded to qualified students exhibiting academic ability and financial need. A minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.75 to 3.0 is required to receive the scholarship award. Undergraduate recipients must maintain a 2.8 GPA during the award period. Graduate recipients must maintain a 3.0 GPA during the award period. The recipient(s) must be enrolled for a minimum of six (6) semester hours each semester. Recipients of the award may reapply for the scholarship award in subsequent years. The scholarship award may be used for tuition, books and/or other required materials, lab fees or other expenses as required by Florida State University Panama City. Disbursements will be made on a semester basis. more...

Law Office Of Jon Friedman Scholarship
The Law Offices of Jon Friedman will be awarding a $500 scholarship to a student pursuing an undergraduate degree in pre-law studies, or a student entering law school in the Fall 2022 semester. This is our 7th annual scholarship and is to be used exclusively for tuition or other related expenses. Students must be accepted into a program at any U.S. school for Fall 2022 and have a GPA of 3.0 or above.
REQUIREMENTS:
The following are required before the application will be considered:
Resume
Essay
A letter showing acceptance
Complete transcripts
A headshot picture of the applicant (If selected as a winner, your image will be used when we announce on the site).
ESSAY:
This scholarship application requires that students write an essay on a topic of their choice, related to an area of law that interests them. Essays should be between one and three pages in length.
AWARD:
The $500 scholarship will be awarded in the first week of January 2023.
A check will be sent to the recipient directly and should be used for tuition and school-related expenses only.
DEADLINE:
The form below will be available for scholarship applications through December 31, 2022. No applications will be accepted after this date.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION
Do not call or contact our law firm directly about the scholarship. Only applications submitted electronically will be considered. more...

Legacy In Medicine Altruism Scholarship Endowment Fund
Recipient must be a student in the College of Medicine in their fourth year who has gone out of their way to improve the health and well being of others through volunteer activities (e.g., homeless shelters, free clinics, Habitat for Humanity, tutoring and literacy programs, fundraising for charitable organizations, etc.) This may include organizational activities or “hands-on” work for those who need it most. Preference will be given to a student who has volunteered or completed placement at a facility whose mission is to increase access to healthcare (such as volunteering at Neighborhood Health Services, community health center, the Mobile Health Unit through the Florida Department of Health, etc.) or students who have volunteered to serve on international service trips to Panama, Mexico, or other Florida State University approved locations. more...

List Of Scholarships And Fellowships (No Citizenship Required)
From ImmigrantsRising.org.
We’re excited to curate this list of scholarships and fellowships that don’t require proof of U.S. citizenship for you! The list has general application eligibility requirements, including education level, region/state, and immigration status (e.g. DACA, TPS, in-state tuition eligibility). Only opportunities with due dates within the next 180 days are shown in the list. Please refer to the webpage linked under “Click to Apply” for the comprehensive eligibility and application requirements.
To view the listings, click “Visit” below. more...

Los Angeles Dui Attorney Diabetes Scholarship
Many of us involved in the site have seen firsthand how diabetes can change a life. Often, it comes without warning and it can radically alter how a person lives from day to day. But we also believe that diabetes should not be an impediment to pursuing your dreams. We want to help a student with diabetes complete their college education and launch their career.
We urge all eligible students to apply, and we look forward to reading the essays and bestowing this scholarship.
Eligibility
You have been diagnosed with diabetes (any type)
You have been accepted to, or are currently enrolled in, an accredited college or university in the U.S. Undergraduate and graduate students are both welcome.
You carry at least a 3.0 GPA.
You must submit an official copy of your transcript, along with your application and essay using our online form.
Essay Topics
Choose ONE of the topics below and write an essay of 500-1,000 words.
What is one way that diabetes has shaped or changed your plans in life? How did confront your diabetes and push forward to your goals?
What one thing do you think would make the biggest difference in how our society treats diabetes?
Picture yourself when you first learned you had diabetes. If you could go back and give one piece of advice to yourself, what would it be?
For more information please visit: https://www.losangelesduiattorney.com/los-angeles-dui-attorney-diabetes-scholarship/ more...

Macdonnell Family Scholarship Endowment
Award for 2022-2023
Karis MacDonnell, an FIU alumna and adjunct faculty member of the College of Education, continues to generously support the endowment she created with her late husband, William, and which initially was dedicated to the memory of his mother, Beatrice Bell Hutchins.  The MacDonnell scholarships reflect the family’s high regard for the noble profession of teaching.
Minimum eligibility requirements:
Must be enrolled as a full-time (12 credits), degree-seeking junior admitted into the Elementary Education program; Sincere desire to teach for more than five years; Demonstrated financial need based on federal financial aid standards as determined by the University’s Financial Aid Office; GPA 3.0 or above Scholarship may be renewed, must re-apply each year and follow procedures; Preference for selection shall be given to previous MacDonnell scholars in good standing. more...

Magellantv Women In Stem Scholarship
MagellanTV is offering $1,000 to FIVE women pursuing degrees in STEM
Women make up less than one-third of the science and engineering workforce, and often don’t get the necessary support for pursuing such a career. MagellanTV wants to support women in pursuit of education in the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) fields, so we’re offering $1,000 each to five female-identifying college or university students seeking higher education in STEM.
How to apply
Complete the application form below. You’ll need proof of upcoming enrollment, and a written essay (300-500 words) or video submission (2-3 minutes) answering the following prompts
What are you studying in the STEM field?
Why are you passionate about your chosen area of study?
What do you hope to use your education for in the future?
Requirements
Submissions will be judged based on thoughtfulness, clarity, creativity, grammar, and how well the above questions are answered. Submissions will not be judged based solely on need.
The application deadline is September 1, 2022 at 5 p.m. PST, and all entries must be submitted prior. No late submissions will be accepted.
To be eligible for the scholarship, applicants must
Be 18 years of age
Identify as female
A U.S. Citizen or Permanent Legal Resident of the United States
Accepted to or enrolled as a full-time student at an accredited college or university
Have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or higher (on a 4-point scale) more...

Maribeth Ehasz And Richard Buhl First Generation Endowed Scholarship
The Maribeth Ehasz and Richard Buhl First Generation Endowed Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Maribeth Ehasz First Generation Endowed Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria
1. Applicant must be enrolled full-time as an undergraduate student at UCF.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. Applicant will have demonstrated involvement and leadership at UCF.
8. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

Maribeth Ehasz First Generation Endowed Scholarship
The Maribeth Ehasz First Generation Endowed Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Mark Blum Memorial Scholarship
Award for 2022-2023
This endowment was established by Sally F. Samuels in memory of her nephew, Mark Blum, an FIU alumnus and Miami-Dade County Public School teacher.  Through her gift, Ms. Samuels honors Mark’s commitment to students and his many years of service to the teaching profession.  Ms. Samuels passed away in 2006.
Minimum Eligibility Requirements:
Must be enrolled as a full-time (12 credits), degree-seeking undergraduate student with a declared major in Education; GPA 3.0 or above, including transfer students; Demonstrated financial need based on federal financial aid standards as determined by the University’s Financial Aid Office; U.S. citizen or permanent resident. The scholarship may be renewed; must re-apply each year and follow procedures; No student can receive the scholarship for more than two academic years.
Recipients MUST be enrolled for the Fall 2022 & Spring 2023 semester. more...

Mark Blum Memorial Scholarship Endowment
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Florida International University College of Education. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need, and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Mark M. And Flora Yon Richardson Memorial Scholarship
The Mark M. and Flora Yon Richardson Memorial Scholarship is available to full-time entering freshmen at Santa Fe College. You must be from Alachua or Bradford County, be a degree-seeking student and have a minimum 2.5 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Mark S. Bloomberg Memorial Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for college seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Veterinary Medicine. Students must demonstrate financial need, good character, strong service commitment, and be accepted into a clinical internship or residency program. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Mark Stoughton Band Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Fine Arts School of Music. Students must be University of Florida band members. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Mark Twain Scholarship Fund, Inc.
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Central Florida. Students must be freethinking and free from ancient or modern mythic interpretations of life and living. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Mark W. Herrbold Memorial Fund Scholarship
Scholarship for third-year medical students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Medicine. Students must demonstrate determination and preserverance. Consideration given to students who have overcome significant adversity during their first three years of medical school. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Mark W. Stoughton Theatre Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for college juniors, seniors, or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Fine Arts School of Theatre and Dance. Students must demonstrate outstanding artistic potential. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Mark Zeigler Endowment For Excellence In Public Speaking Education
Recipient must be a student in the College of Communication and Information and a member of the public speaking program. more...

Marla Kace Siegel Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Florida Atlantic University in the Biomedical program. Preference given to students studying breast cancer. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Marlin Eller Memorial Mwi Corporation Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Agricultural and Life Sciences Department of Agricultural and Biological Engineering majoring in Agricultural and Biological Engineering. Students must have financial need and demonstrate potential and scholarship. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Marlin Engineering Scholarship
Scholarship for Miami-Dade County, Florida residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Florida International University majoring in Civil and Environmental Engineering. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Number of awards may vary. A personal statement and resume must be included with application packet. more...

Marlin Family Burnett Honors College First Generation Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria
1. Applicant must be enrolled at least half-time (6 credits) as an undergraduate student at UCF in the Burnett Honors College.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance. more...

Marlin Family Burnett Honors College First Generation Scholarship
The Marlin Family Burnett Honors College First Generation Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Dentistry. Students must demonstrate financial need, academic achievement, and motivation. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Mart P. Hill Endowment For Student Excellence In Biological Science
Recipient must be a student in the College of Arts and Sciences within the Department of Biological Science. Preference will be given to a student focused in the areas of evolutionary biology and ecology. more...

You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Martha B. Carter Scholarship

Martha B. Davis Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Florida College in Temple Terrace, Florida. Applicants must have financial need and have academic promise. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Martha H. Hitt And Dr. Phillips Charities First Generation Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
The purpose of the Fund is to provide scholarship awards to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. Recipients will be selected based on the following established criteria:
1. The applicant must be a first generation college student.
2. The applicant must be a Florida resident.
3. Have attempted less 132 total credit hours
4. The applicant must be Pell eligible
5. The applicant must demonstrate financial need based upon guidelines set forth in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
-First preference will be given to students enrolled in programs at the University of Central Florida Downtown Campus.
-First preference will be given to residents of Orange and Osceola County, Florida.
If a student cannot be identified who meets the first preference, preference will be given to students who are first generation college students. more...

Martha H. Hitt And Dr. Phillips Charities First Generation Scholarship
The Martha H. Hitt and Dr. Phillips Charities First Generation Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. You must be a first generation college student, a Florida resident, and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. Preference will be given to students enrolled in programs at the University of Central Florida-Downtown Campus and to students who are Orange and Osceola County, FL. more...

Martha H. Hitt First Generation Endowed Scholarship
Part of the First Generation Matching Grant Program. Additional state requirements must be considered when selecting recipients.
Criteria
1. Applicant must be enrolled full-time as an undergraduate student at UCF.
2. Applicant must be a Florida Resident and U.S Citizen or eligible Non-Citizen.
3. Applicant must not have received a baccalaureate degree.
4. Applicant must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
5. Applicant must not have defaulted on or owe a refund to any previous aid program.
6. Applicant must be considered as ‘First Generation’.
First Generation Student is defined as neither of the student’s parents earned a college degree at the baccalaureate level or higher.
7. Applicant will have demonstrated involvement and leadership at UCF.
8. The criteria for awarding the Scholarship will be consistent with the guidelines established by the University of Student Financial Assistance.
9. This scholarship is renewable up to 8 semesters. more...

Martinwren Community Justice Scholarship
MartinWren, P.C. is comprised of attorneys and their staff who are committed to helping their community both professionally and personally. We take pride in being able to help improve the lives of individuals and their families in our home community, as well as being able to support the small businesses that further complete our sense of community. We do this in our work as professionals, and we do this in our own time as individuals who are members of community-based organizations and projects that we are passionate about.
We feel fortunate to be able to support our community both in the work that we do and in our time outside of work. We would like to support the education of a student who is passionate and committed to helping their community be a better place.
The MartinWren Community Justice Scholarship is open to higher education students of all majors and levels of study, who can demonstrate their commitment to community justice and to making their community a better place.
Eligibility Criteria:
This scholarship is open to any student who is currently enrolled in an accredited undergraduate, graduate, or professional, program in the United States.

This includes accredited community college students; and high school seniors and students who possess a GED, who have been accepted to or enrolled in an accredited program.


All eligible candidates must be in good academic standing with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.00 or above.
The scholarship candidate must possess an interest in community justice as demonstrated by past and present volunteer, professional, and/or educational experiences.
Application Requirements:
Updated resume
Current unofficial transcript
A brief response (1,000 word maximum) that addresses the essay prompt and questions below
Essay Question
Answer the following prompt and questions in an essay of 1,000 words or less:
Describe an experience that made you feel passionate about wanting to help people in your community.
What is a community need that you feel passionate about trying to provide to people in your community?
How do you plan to help to fulfill this need in the future?
How have your education and education goals informed how you are planning to help improve your community?
Submission Deadline: December 15, 2022
Award Announcement: January 2023
Scholarship Amount: $1,000
Application Instructions:
Scholarship applicants must submit all application materials (see above) by email to: ashiflett@martinwrenlaw.com

If you have questions, please feel free to email ashiflett@martinwrenlaw.com more...

Marvin And Hazel Shanken Dei Scholarship
The Marvin and Hazel Shanken DEI Scholarship Fund—In the pursuit of greater equity in the Hospitality and Tourism industry, The Marvin and Hazel Shanken DEI Scholarship Fund will be a once renewable scholarship reserved for under-represented minority junior, senior and graduate students—with an emphasis on transfers from Hispanic Serving Institutions (HSI) and Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) students pursuing a hospitality education at FIU’s Chaplin School of Hospitality and Tourism Management
Eligibility criteria for the scholarship are as follows:
The scholarships will be awarded to junior, senior, and/or graduate level students enrolled in or accepted for admission to the School.
Students must have a 2.0 gpa or above to be eligible to compete for the award
Student must be a U.S. citizens, permanent resident or international student on an aid eligible visa to apply
Award can be renewed once. Awarded to assist in covering room, board or tuition costs. more...

Master Of Science In Finance (Msf) Merit Scholarship
The Master of Science in Finance (MSF) program was established in the year 2000, and for nearly the past 20 years, the program has been dedicated to establishing leading professionals for the industry.
This scholarship was designed to reward individuals who have shown exemplary academic and work achievements.
To be eligible for the scholarship:
Individual must be admitted into the MSF in-person format at FIU to start Spring (January) 2023 – and not enrolled in classes. Neither applicants nor current, enrolled, students are eligible for this scholarship
Must meet one of the following requirements:
Minimum upper-division GPA of 3.25 and a GMAT score of 600, or

Minimum upper-division GPA of 3.25 and a GRE score of 158 on the quantitative section and 160 on the verbal section, or

Finance undergraduate degree with a 3.5 upper-division GPA with proof of community service, internship, or extra-curricular involvement, or

Eight years of financial related work experience with a minimum GPA of 3.25 upper-division coursework, or

Previously earned a master’s degree with a 3.5 GPA, alongside a 3.25 upper-division GPA in undergraduate coursework
Meeting minimum eligibility requirements does not guarantee scholarship. more...

Master Sergeant Floyd Sheffield Scholarship
Recipient must be a student enrolled in Military Science (MSL) courses who is contracted with Florida State University United States Army ROTC. Preference will be given to a student who is the child or dependent of an active or retired military family member or one who has transferred to Florida State University from one of the following schools in order of priority: 1. Gulf Coast State College; 2. Tallahassee Community College; 3. any out-of-state junior college such that the parent is an active duty military Florida resident and is attending said out-of-state program due to the parent’s current duty obligations or assignments. more...

Mayor Alex G. Fekete Scholarship
Award for 2022-2023
Former Pembroke Pines Mayor Alex G. Fekete, in his commitment to education and our youth, founded this scholarship to support educators and education’s future.  Through the Mayor Alex G. Fekete Annual Golf Tournament, named “A Tradition for the Millennium,” with the gracious support of corporate sponsors, participants and volunteers, the event proceeds were contributed to establish and grow a scholarship endowment in support of students and teachers of Pembroke Pines.
Minimum Eligibility Requirements:
Must be enrolled as a full-time, degree-seeking student (12 credits undergraduate / 9 credits graduate) in Education; Education major; Pembroke Pines resident or attending FIU Pines Center more...

Meridian Amp Medical Scholarship
The Meridian Leasing Aspiring Medical Professionals (AMP) Scholarship is designed to identify and provide scholarship and academic support for high school students who aspire to earn medical degrees and to pursue careers in healthcare. The Meridian AMP Scholarship helps highly capable students pursue an undergraduate medical major by providing a $1,000 annual scholarship so they can receive the education they need to become a successful professional in the medical field.
Qualifications
You must be passionate about and be actively seeking a future in healthcare
The application is open for high school seniors who are entering college
Must maintain a cumulative grade point average of 3.5 or higher or equivalent
Requirements
Complete your application by December 31st, 2019.
Complete and submit an original application essay (1,000-1,500 words) about how the healthcare industry is evolving and the importance for hospitals and healthcare institutions to keep up with those advancements through their imaging equipment
Submit your most recent official High School transcript
Submit a letter of recommendation detailing why you would be the best candidate for this scholarship
For more information, please click the “Visit” button below more...

Modern Canna Scholarship
Modern Canna Laboratories (Modern Canna) is regarded as Florida’s first medical cannabis laboratory and works directly with licensed Medical Marijuana Treatment Centers (MMTCs) and licensed hemp producers to help ensure that medical marijuana, medical marijuana-derived products, and hemp-derived products are safe for human consumption. Modern Canna’s laboratories are ISO/IEC 17025 accredited and licensed certified marijuana testing labs (CMTL) in the state of Florida. The Modern Canna Scholarship has been created in an effort to help young scholars achieve their science-oriented academic goals.
You will be asked to complete an online application which includes:
General background information (e.g. contact information and details about your current university or college)
Resume/CV highlighting degree and current/past experience in related fields
Academic transcripts from your current institutions (and prior, if applicable)
Responses to one short answer essay question (Refer below)
15 minutes “meet and greet” per shortlist participant
Essay Questions:
Create a brief essay that tells us about:

What are the medicinal benefits of cannabis?
Why is proper laboratory testing of medical cannabis necessary?
How will the Modern Canna Scholarship help you achieve your goals?
The response to the several questions above should be written in English and be 500 words or less.*
Responses will be based on:
50% = Thoughtfulness of response
30% = Relevance to prompt
15% = Quality of composition
5% = Grammatical accuracy
IMPORTANT: Before starting the application, please have the following ready for upload:
PDF copy of your resume

PDF copy of your current or most recent transcript (unofficial is acceptable)

PDF copy of your two short-answer responses
Deadline
Friday, Apr 29, 2022 at 11:59 PM EST more...

Msire Merit Scholarship
This scholarship was designed to reward individuals who have shown exemplary academic and work achievements.
To be eligible for the scholarship:
Be admitted into the Spring (January) 2023 start term of the MS in International Real Estate program
Current enrolled students are not eligible for this scholarship.
Must meet one of the following requirements:
Minimum upper-division GPA of 3.25 and a GMAT score of 600, or
Minimum upper-division GPA of 3.25 and a GRE score of 158 on the quantitative section and 160 on the verbal section, or
Real Estate & Finance undergraduate degree with a 3.5 upper-division GPA with proof of community service, internship, or extra-curricular involvement, or
Ten years of real estate related work experience with a minimum GPA of 3.25 upper-division coursework, or
Previously earned a master’s degree with a 3.5 GPA, alongside a 3.25 upper-division GPA in undergraduate real estate or finance coursework
Meeting minimum eligibility requirements does not guarantee scholarship. more...

My Wife Quit Her Job Scholarship
At MyWifeQuitHerJob.com, we are dedicated to teaching entrepreneurship to the masses.
We celebrate students who strive for excellence, and we are proud to launch our first scholarship for an outstanding university student.
This scholarship will be open to both undergrad and graduate students who are attending an accredited university within the United States.
The My Wife Quit Her Job scholarship provides a one-time reward of $500 to pay for tuition, books, computers, room, and board, or any education-related expense.
There are no GPA requirements and no application forms. This is our way of giving back and supporting individuals who want to pursue their dreams through education.
Details
Scholarship name: My Wife Quit Her Job $500 Scholarship
Deadline: August 22, 2023. No applications will be accepted after that date.
Scholarship value: $500.
Number of scholarships available: One per year
Who Can Apply?
Must be 18 years or older
Must be a legal resident of the United States or hold a valid student visa
Must be currently enrolled in or accepted to a full-time undergraduate or graduate program in an accredited U.S. university, college, or school
How to Apply
The applicant must write a 1000-word essay on a meaningful event that changed your life.
Essays must be sent to scholarships@mywifequitherjob.com as an attached Word document file, along with the applicant’s full name, address, phone number, school name, and date of birth. “My Wife Quit Her Job $500 Scholarship | Full Name” should be used as the subject line of the email.
Only one submission per person is allowed and you must follow these instructions exactly. Applicants must be able to prove their eligibility based on the abovementioned criteria.
By applying, you agree to allow My Wife Quit Her Job to use your photo and personal information for marketing purposes if you are the chosen winner.
Selection Details
Send us your response following the guidelines above. Our team will pick the best response and will notify the winner via email on or before September 22, 2023. The winner should respond within 7 days; otherwise, another awardee will be selected.
For further information, interested students can contact scholarships@mywifequitherjob.com. more...

Myelisting Foundation Scholarship
We are currently offering scholarships for students for the school year starting Fall 2022. All you have to do is answer our essay prompt in 500 to 800 words, send it in, and wait to hear back.
Participating students will have a chance to highlight their local community as part of the scholarship application process.
Eligibility
To be eligible for our scholarship opportunities, you must be:
A legal U.S. resident;
Graduating high school senior or current freshman, sophomore, or junior in college attending an accredited university or college;
Eighteen years of age or older.
Entry is subject to the official terms and conditions.
As further set forth in the official rules, your entry grants us full permission to republish and otherwise freely use your entry materials and your name and likeness in order to promote MyEListing, its subsidiaries, or other third parties.
All winners will be required to complete an Affidavit of Eligibility, Publicity Release, Liability Waiver, and IRS Form W-9.
No purchase is necessary, and no fees are required to enter. One signup/account per person.
Scholarship Awards and Amounts
Three scholarships will be awarded per quarter based on participants’ 500 to 800-word responses to our essay prompt, including insights about their local neighborhood.
The scholarship awards are:
$1,000 for 1st place
$750 for 2nd place
$500 for 3rd place
These three winners will also receive the MyEListing.com Excellence in Real Estate Writing Award, an award that will serve as an excellent addition to your resume.
The next MyEListing.com scholarship awards will be delivered in September of 2022.
The Essay Prompt
The essay prompt for the Fall 2022 quarter is:
“We often take for granted the local services we use every day in our communities, like retail outlets, car washes, movie theaters, and more. What are some additions (or removals) to these services that you believe would increase the quality of life in your area?”
Please write and submit your response in a double-spaced Word document, editable PDF, or RTF format.
Please note: Every quarter, this essay topic will change. These changes will take effect on the last month of Q1 (March), Q2 (June), Q3 (September), and Q4 (December). more...

Nava Law Group Scholarship
Nava Law Group, P.C. is awarding a $1000 scholarship to one qualified student who plans to become an attorney. Pre-law undergraduates and students entering law school anywhere in the United States are eligible. The scholarship is meant to help defray the costs of tuition or other related expenses.
Eligibility
Applicants must meet the following criteria:
Citizens of the United States, or legal residents who are authorized to work
Accepted into a U.S. university as a pre-law undergraduate or attending law school
Planning to enroll in courses during Fall 2022
Minimum of a 3.0 GPA
Requirements:
As a part of the application process, interested students must submit the following by December 1, 2022:
Resume
1-3 page typed essay on the subject matter related to the area of law you intend to pursue
A complete copy of school transcripts
Proof of acceptance from a U.S. school
Proof you legally reside in the U.S. (birth certificate, permanent resident card, passport – Social Security Cards will not be accepted
Award:
The scholarship award winner will be selected on the last week of December 2022, and notification of the winning student will follow. The $1000 will be issued in the form of a check made payable to the student, to be used for tuition or related educational expenses only. The scholarship recipient will be required to submit receipts showing how the money was spent.
Deadline:
Only applications received on or before December 1, 2022, will be considered.
Scholarship Application
Do not call or contact our law firm directly about the scholarship. Only applications submitted electronically will be considered. more...

Nelson R. Griesheimer Scholarship

New World School Of The Arts Scholarship

New York Times Scholarships
Scholarship for Florida residents who reside in a New York Times Regional Newspaper group circulation area and are college juniors or seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Journalism and Communications majoring in Advertising or Journalism. Students must demonstrate academic achievement and leadership potential, be pursuing a career in journalism or newspaper advertising, and demonstrate ability to overcome educational, social, or family disadvantages. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Newh South Florida Chapter Scholarship
NEWH South Florida Chapter is awarding scholarships up to $20,000 to students pursuing a major and career objective within the Hospitality Industry (interior design, hospitality management, culinary, architecture, etc.). Scholarship submission deadline date is September 15, 2022.
Scholarship criteria:
Actively enrolled student: 2-year program freshman and above, 4-year sophomore/second year and above, or graduate level attending college in: Southern Florida
3.0 GPA (cumulative) overall “B” average or grade percentage of 83% – 86% equivalent
Financial need through college for past/current/upcoming tuition or program approved books/supplies
Major and career objective within a hospitality related field (interior design, hospitality management, culinary, etc.)
Did you know?
NEWH membership is not required but is FREE to students + full-time educators
Students may apply by email, mail or online: www.newh.org (Scholarship/Chapter Scholarship Applications/South Florida)
To download the application, click “Visit” below. more...

Newins & Ziegler Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Florida College of Agricultural and Life Sciences School of Forest Resources and Conservation. Students must have completed a minimum of 100 credit hours and demonstrate leadership skills. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Nextlevel Law Scholarship
We Are Currently Accepting Applications!
The Chicago family law firm NextLevel Law believes in making a positive impact in its community. Founding attorney Daniel Hernandez built his legal practice on the values of accessibility, integrity, respect, and transparency. NextLevel Law brings justice to our clients and makes high-quality legal services accessible to all members of the communities we serve.
Attorney Hernandez and his legal team also believe in accessible education. Through the NextLevel Student Scholarship, NextLevel Law hopes to make higher education more accessible to college students who demonstrate academic excellence.
The $1,000 NextLevel Law Scholarship is available to students each semester who are pursuing a career in law, compliance, or public policy.
Applications for the Fall 2022 Scholarship Must be Submitted by September 22, 2022
Are You Eligible For Our Scholarship?
All eligible applicants for the NextLevel Student Scholarship must meet the following criteria:
Applicant is an undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a career in law, compliance, or public policy.
Applicant is enrolled in an accredited college or university for the Fall 2022 semester.
Applicant must have a GPA of 3.5 or higher.
What to Know
About Our Application
To apply for the NextLevel Student Scholarship, please submit an original one-minute video answering the following prompt:
VIDEO PROMPT
Throughout life, we will all be presented with challenges to overcome. Tell us about a time when you were presented with a challenge or obstacle. How did that challenge help you to become a better leader?
Additionally, we require that each application include the student’s contact information, professional headshot, proof of enrollment, and proof of grade point average.
How Will We Judge Your Application?
The scholarship team at NextLevel Law will consider the following grading rubric when reviewing each application:
Does the student meet all eligibility criteria?Did the student submit all the requested information?
Does the video answer the prompt in an original and creative manner?
Is the video of high quality with clear audio and organized structure?
If You Have Questions…
Direct all questions regarding our scholarship program to our email, scholarship@nextlevel.law. Please refrain from using our contact submission form or calling into the office.
Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you. more...
